Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel to be in an excellent location, literally a 5 minute walk from the walk of fame. The room was spacious and beds were comfortable. The room had a funny smell when left closed for the day but quickly dissipated. The heating was also a little noisy but nothing to keep you awake. The free breakfast was also a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: JMichael69
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a very reasonable price! Service was well above average thanks to the manager. Our room was large and very clean. The breakfast was typical for a HI. The location was very good for us and was close to everything in Hollywood. Strip mall close by had a Starbucks, C-store and Subway. We drove and the valet parking was reasonably priced and convenient. Our only complaint was the very slow internet access. My wife and I plan to return to the area in June to visit our daughter and plan to stay at this HI again. I am a Marriott Rewards member but have really liked the HI Express experience and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Hollywood Locations!”
Reviews.Author: CC161
Reviews.Content: It is located on Highland avenue, about a five minute walk to Hollywood Blvd and all the sites. The hotel offers free breakfast and its a decent breakfast with coffee, juice and most items you would need for a day of sightseeing. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves were comfortable with great beds and pillows and a fantastic shower. Would definately recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to spend most of their time in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: NancyR007
Reviews.Content: Convient location about 3 blocks from Hollywood Blvd. No problems walking to and from hotel at night. Nice clean hotel with very helpful staff. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Very Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: R-J-W07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. We arrived at the hotel early and were able to go to our room with no problems. The check-in was easy and friendly. The room was clean, comfy beds, comfy pillows, wi-fi and a good size room for two adults and two children (11&13). Plus a yummy brekky every morning! The location was great... only two blocks to the Walk of Fame, Metro, Hollywood & Highland Centre (where there are lots of places to eat), Graumans Chinese Theatre, Madame Tussauds and more. A few tips... There is an information booth just near the Metro. Ask there for directions to Citidel Outlet Mall. We got a train and bus (through some dodgy areas of LA) but well worth going for shopping bargains. Also, get a bus to Santa Monica... it's well worth a look. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BraveTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after visiting Six Flags. We had our two young adult children with us so we booked two rooms. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast buffet was a perfect way to start the day. There was something for everyone to fill up on. The only thing lacking at this hotel was any 'concierge' service. The front staff were not very helpful with suggestions but very helpful with calling cabs and accomodating any 'hotel' requests. The location was perfect for walking to Hollywood Blvd. Just a side note that when you are walking back to the hotel from Hollywood Blvd. the first liquor store is much cheaper than the second :) A bit of a drag to have to pay $20/day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deesol714
Reviews.Content: This was a reallly great place to stay. Very colse to where I needed to be. I have to give compliments to the breakfast that is offered too. Also on the women that greats me everyday when I just get in right before the 9:30 cutoff. She always greets me with a warm smile and a goodmorning. The entire staff aims to please in every way they can.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: arnieTsv
Reviews.Content: Arriving before check-in time, expecting to drop our luggage, our rooms were ready and we were checked in. The rooms were comfortable as was the bed and pillows. The room was quiet and the included breakfast was simple but fine. The staff were friendly and helpful and also arranged transportation for us. The location is great, not far to walk from Hollywood Blvd and free wifi was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Travelcat097
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for a couple of nights but found the room extremely comfortable and slept well even though we could hear the road noise outside. Lovely breakfast included with a good choice of hot and cold options. Liked the sausage and egg muffin which you could build yourself. There was s lovely lady keeping the breakfast area tidy and stocking up the food. She always gave us a warm welcome and took pride in her work. Great location, easy walking distance to the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Hop on Hop off buses, Chinese Theatre and Kodak Theatre. Good choice of restaurants nearby. Good value for money and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!! Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: FionaWarren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January/February 2011. Highly recommend this hotel, all staff were very friendly and helpful. 5 minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and the walk of fame/chinese theatre. Room was very nice decor, bed comfortable, in room safe. Hotel has a guest laundry and free breakfast which was SOO good, toast, eggs, bacon, cakes & pastries, coffee & juices - very good. Complimentary use of internet / business centre. We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of our USA trip and it was a wonderful start to the holiday! Would stay here again, as previously stayed in other area's of LA - this was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean ,convenient for tourists.Great breakfast. Thankyou!”
Reviews.Author: JANal50
Reviews.Content: Would defineatly stay again when in the area. We walked everywhere except our tour to beaches and beverly hills etc. Good crepes restaurant can sit outside at upper level of mall. very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: tr59
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Jan. 2011 with my 2 daughters and I felt very comfortable and safe here at the Holiday Inn Express. We arrived just before 1:00pm so I was not expecting my room to be ready but we were told to make ourselves comfortable in the lobby and our room would be ready in half an hour, but it was ready sooner than that. We were very happy about that, we dropped off our suitcases and changed and off we were to Hollywood blvd to start our holiday. The room was very nice and clean, nice flat screen TV, bar fridge and good size bathroom. The beds and pillows were a little soft but we asked for more pillows and they sent them up right away. The free breakfast was great, very nice and clean and it was perfect to get up in the morning and go get something to eat. The location was great, it was close to Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre, Chinese theatre, Hollywood and Highland centre which we really liked. We were always greeted by the front desk and they were helpful with any questions we asked. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ABColby
Reviews.Content: Family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers from Australia stayed for 4 nights mid January. Last stay of month long holiday and hotel made it very hard to leave. Staff were extremely friendly and patient with our many questions, they had great advice and tips, went to a Lakers game and gave all metro info etc on that. Used car service to transfer us to LAX driver was wonderful, full of info and very personable. Room were huge which more than accommodated our 8 suitcases! Only fault is we had a room facing road which could be noisy during night and early morning but that is unavoidable and not fault of hotel. Breakfast was a nice bonus and stocks and breakfast room well maintained by diligent lady. Location was excellent being minutes to Hollywood Blvd and Metro station, will definitely choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: vegiemite6
Reviews.Content: Three of us shared a room with 2 queen beds. The room and bathroom was very spacious, it was clean and quiet. Breakfast was pretty simple, being a Holiday Inn Express it was all about paper plates etc. The breakfast room would fill up quickly at peak time, so it was hard to get a table some mornings. There is a small supermarket/liqour store across the road, but not much else close by - great location though as it is a short walk to the walk of fame, restuarants, tourist information, train station. If you go to disneyland, either book the daytour through starlines (located at walk of fame) the day or two before, or actually stay at the hotels next to disneyland - we got public transport and it took 2-3hrs - absolute nightmare! We went with starlines to universal studios which was so easy - dropped us off and picked us up from hollywood walk of fame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: james_rosevear
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Holiday Inn Hollywood Walk of Fame. I stayed here in November & December 2009 for seven nights and had a wonderful experience. I most recently stayed here from the 28th of November to the 9th of December 2010 and I enjoyed it just as much as the first time. This hotel has friendly staff, lovely rooms, free wi-fi and a complimentary breakfast each morning with a generous selection of food. It's only a five minute walk to the Hollywood and Highland Centre, Graumann's Chinese Theatre, Madame Tussauds. Just across the road is a sushi restaurant, starbucks, subway, pizza parlor and a convenience store The only downside is the parking fee of US$22 per day, but I rented a car for just two days and used the metro every other day. I will definately stay here next time i'm in Los Angeles and I would like to thank all of the staff for making my stay an absolute pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samelimama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as good as most three star properties I have stayed at. The location is great with or without a car. I only stay at new or newly renovated properties and I was very pleased. The free breakfast was better than any I've had at a hotel. The only negative was the price of parking and the temp. of the "heated pool". The water was very cold and the temp. outside was 80 degrees. I don't think it is really heated.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: bandit1118
Reviews.Content: Continental breakfast worker deserves a raise. She was very pleasant and making sure everything was kept in stock and tables cleaned immediately. The $22 a day charge to park car overnight was ridiculous. A little expensive I'd say.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel! Great service, breakfast - some rooms a little noisy...”
Reviews.Author: BrandonZ
Reviews.Content: All in all my 3 night stay at this hotel was great. The room was nice and cleaned well. It was large and the bed was definitely quite comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was a joke but that might be something to do with LA and not the hotel itself - so I won't take off marks for that. The breakfast from 6:30-9:30 daily was standard but had everything you need for a good wakeup. My only complaint is that my room on the third floor was beneath the breakfast area on the 4th floor. It made it extremely difficult to sleep past 8am. Lots of movement could be heard overhead. The pool was nice although I didn't use it, and the gym was 2 treadmill and 2 ellipticals, which I used but the room was definitely lacking. Oh the wifi is free- which is great but the connection varies a lot and can drop out sometimes. Overall, a solid stay and I would definitely stay again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not far from Walk of Fame”
Reviews.Author: Brizzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is excellent for seeing the sights of Hollywood. The Walk of Fame (Hollywood Blvd) is about a 10 minute walk down the road. Here you can board the hop-on / hop-off buses which take you to pretty much all the touristy locations. To the north is Universal Studios, which is only about a 15 minute drive away also. The hotel itself is in good condition. The rooms were spacious and clean. The buffet breakfast (included) was also good. Staff were friendly and able to help us out with directions & recommendations. The wi-fi was free and worked the majority of the time. Overall, a great hotel for your LA trip.

Reviews.Title: “close to Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: natashacampbell77
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and short walk to Hollywood Blvd. We stayed on the 3rd floor, under the breakfast room, it was a little noisy, chairs scrapping and what sounded like people running around. Wasn't impressed with Hollywood though. If I had to go to Hollywood again,would stay here. Free breakfast was pretty good, and free internet was excellent. Close to food and shops. Check in definetly not available before the stated time, we had to wait for 3 hours, after a 14 hr flight, our fault we were aware of the check in time.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable base to explore LA”
Reviews.Author: nemo500
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located near the Hollywood Walk of Fame. We had terrible weather while we were in LA and so not being near the beach was not a problem! We found plenty to do and see in the local area and as we had a car we were able to explore LA quite easily. We booked a wheelchair accessible room (with full roll-in shower) and it was perfect for my partners needs. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, the hotel was clean and staff were very helpful and friendly. LA was our last stop on a five week tour of North America, we certainly found that this hotel surpassed the quality and service of some full service and far more pricey hotels that we had stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot to be in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: kramerpuss
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Hollywood, the HI express was the perfect location for a Hollywood base. A short pleasant walk to the Chinese Theatre, Starline tours start point and Walk of Fame. No need for a car if exploring this area. The shops are great and a good market just over the road for supplies. Marieta at breakfast is just delightful, always welcoming with a cheery 'good morning'. The breakfast was a great start to the day, whilst you plan your adventure. Universal studios only a short cab ride approx $12. We had a great time with a 12 and 10 yo. Great Fun ;)

Reviews.Title: “Deff stay again”
Reviews.Author: amymck1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, it had everything we needed and more, it was very clean and had lots of room, the breakfast was very yummy, and even better as it is included in price, we were only a 5 min walk to the main attractions, walk of fame, chinese theatre etc so it was good for us. Would deff stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: CAmamaof3
Reviews.Content: After visiting Universal Studios we were kind of winging it on where to stay that night. The kids wanted to check out Hollywood and the Walk of Fame so we stopped here to check out and price. The price was fair and the surrounding area looked nice (some parts of Hollywood are pretty bad) so we booked it. It was a very nice looking hotel with pretty decor. The breakfast was good, much better than expected. There was a weirdo at the pool that told my two girls (age 15 & 13) to take thier clothes off and jump in as he was disrobing, he said "hey it's ok, it's Hollywood" That was a little off putting but no fault of the hotels. All the hotel emplyees were very nice and smiley. Oh, if you go to the 7th floor up the stairs there is a door to outside that leads to outside stairs. If you go up the stairs to the street there is a great view of the Hollywood sign (I am not sure this is suppose to be accessed by guest of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: W0rldWideWebb
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel. The rooms are fresh and clean and of good size with modern TV and fridge, and the staff very helpful (though mainly DIY which in many respects I prefer in a hotel). We were in a room on the 4th floor overlooking the Highland Hotel carpark and there was little-to-no road noise back there. The free breakfast was good value, located on the 4th floor next to the pool (which we unfortunately didn't get to use). The hotel is 2 blocks from the Kodak Center where you can take the walk of fame, visit Madam Tassaud's, various bus tours, or take the subway station to Universal Studios. A few words of warning: the Hollywood precinct is very touristy and IMHO overrated (though I highly recommend Universal Studios); there is a small store across the road from the hotel and is a bit on the expensive side but still probably your best bet for supplies across the precinct; and the vending machines/ice machines aren't sound insulated as I've seen in some other hotels so I imagine staying in a room nearby wouldn't be a particularly enjoyable experience. That said, I highly recommend this hotel as a base for holidaying in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: MayMaxKen
Reviews.Content: We, hubby, 8 year old son and I had a great 4 nights stay at Holiday Inn Walk of Fame. We enjoyed the breakfast and also chatted with Maria, the breakfast lady and the lady painter who painted all the celebrities on the car park walls. We love the location and we got ourselves a weekly ticket (USD 22) and went to The Groves, Farmers Market, Beverley Center, Chinatown, Union Station, Olvera Street, Santa Monica, Rodeo Drive, Universal Studio and Citadel outlet. We had the fantastic In N Out burgers too. The locals were all very friendly when we asked for directions. LA we will be back : )

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tancred32
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with the location of this hotel. We stayed 3 nights and it was great to have breakfast provided. It was an easy walk to Hollywood Boulevard. Room was clean and front desk staff were helpful. Didn't notice any noise from the busy street below. Stay in this hotel if you want a reasonable price, good location and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: behindthesewalls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during my trip to Los Angeles. First, the staff was always great when I asked them some questions. But, I didn't have a car and I asked to the guy from the front desk where to take a picture with the hollywood sign and he give a place to go, but he didn't talk about the walk (he just said it's going to take 10 minutes). I mean you need to go to the top of a mountain and he didn't talk about how it was ( if you're not in shape forget it). Except this little accident, everything run smooth, we arrived at the hotel at like 11 am and we weren't able to the check out, so they took our luggage and we went to the hollywood blvd. Great location if you want to stay in Hollywood, if you don't have the chance to have a car, be ready to wait a lot... There's a subway in front of hotel and some others little restaurants. The room was great and the hotel was full booked but we never had a problem to sleep or anything. Maybe a little bit expensive for only a holiday inn express during the week end, but every hotel are expensive near to the hollywood blvd. If you have car, you should go to the hollywood reservoir (lake tahoe drive) you gonna get the best picture for the hollywood sign! Also the printer at the front desk was out of service but the every time I went to the front desk and I take their printer and use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our experience”
Reviews.Author: ODN67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Walk of Fame for 3 nights starting 29th September this year. The staff were friendly, and helpful. The free breakfast was one of the better ones we experienced on our trip. It is literally 5 minutes walk to Hollywood Blvd, and although there are some homeless people around, we always felt safe in this area. Our room was nice and clean. Lots of traffic on Highland Drive especially when there is an event on in the area, but we never heard it from our room. We didn't get a chance to make the most of the facilities but they looked nice. Having a guest laundry is a huge bonus. Reception was happy to give us change for the machines and they have a mini-store there if you run out of something in the middle of the night. The reception is also 24 hours. If you are heading to Universal Studios, a 5 minute walk to the Metro Railway at Hollywood/Highland and one stop ... dead easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean ,comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LibbyAlbury
Reviews.Content: Good location close to many attractions and we felt safe. Good shops at Highland centre - Victoria's secret and GAP to name a couple.Caught the subway to Universal studios and Downtown on a number of occasions and times and to the Staples Centre - very easy and safe - just be aware around you like any traveller! I travelled with my 17 year old son. Room was on same floor as breakfast, pool and business centre. Breakfast kept us going until late afternoon - hot and cold options. Pool looked good although didn't swim in it. Room had an inroom safe, wireless internet and air conditioning - all worked well. No restaurant for dinner but that didn't matter as place opposite could buy take away and mini supermarket. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mils567
Reviews.Content: We love to travel, but we never splurge. So we decided to go to holiday inn express. We were not disappointed. Just a Block walk to hollywood walk of fame, very safe place to stay, and comes with nice daily complimentary breakfast. The only thing is $20 a night parking, but what can you expect.. its HOLLYWOOD area! Overall this hotel carries the holiday inn standard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: cakemonster
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise. I booked at this location solely because of the price--after having experience less-than-deal Holiday Inns, I had no expectations. For less than $160, this was incredible. The rooms were spacious and well-equipped, and I was relieved to find that I couldn't hear too much outside noise. The location of the hotel itself was fantastic--just a hop away from Hollywood Boulevard and near the metro and the 101. The staff were very nice, especially the helpful valets and the wonderful lady who runs the free (and bountiful) breakfast buffet (which includes eggs and bacon in addition to the usual continental stuff). Parking isn't free, but at $20 a day, it's a good deal. You do need to drive a lot in LA! Overall, shockingly good find. Absolutely would recommend this to anyone desiring the most luxury that no-frills sort of places provide.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: esil6
Reviews.Content: We recently stay here for 4 days while visiting Hollywood. Our room was on the 7th floor and was bright, clean, and quiet. We really enjoyed our stay. The free breakfast was a yummy way to start our day and the area was kept spotless and fully stocked by a very efficient, pleasant associate. We're not huge breakfast eaters so we were very pleased with their offerings. The front desk was as helpful and professional as could be. They ackowledged each person who entered their lobby. Again, just a pleasant experience. LA is so huge that when you are only there for a few days, you have to commit to an area and explore it. We were close to many attractions that most people were coming to the area to see. It was a 5 minute walk to Starbucks and the Walk of Fame, and free tapings of the Jimmy Kimmel Live show. Just a bit further walk let you visit LA Ink and Pink's for a hotdog. Everyday you can see the HOLLYWOOD sign in the hills behind you. The other hotel in the area that looked nice was the Roosevelt. Most of the others I didn't think were anything special. Also, no hidden charges - free WI-FI, laundry facilities, etc. We had a blast and were very happy with our choice of hotel. Hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, clean & excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SATCgirl
Reviews.Content: As we checked in late, around 11pm, the staff was very friendly and had all the paperwork ready for us. We got in our rooms, which were VERY clean! As I said, the room was very clean & big enough for myself and my friend. The hotel was very close to Hollywood Blvd - where all the action is in Hollywood (it was about a 5-10 minute walk). Having the breakfast included with our room fees was excellent. They had something for everyone - eggs, bacon, sausages, toast, muffins, bagels, cereal, juice, coffee, milk, water ect.... The pool is outdoors, we didn't go in it as this was in October and it was to cold. I would probably stay at this hotel again if I were to visit Hollywood again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable rates, room has all you need.”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: Location is very close to walk of fame. five minutes walking. That area gets sketchy at night so pay attention. The rooms were clean and large. Everything was how it should be. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service!!”
Reviews.Author: graham1007
Reviews.Content: Excellent location of this hotel just 2 minutes from the walk of fame and the Kodak Theatre. The hotel itself was clean, and comfortable for the 5 nights we were there. Lovely large comfy beds with goodsize bathrooms. Staff were friendly and helpful and the valet parking service was always useful and well priced compared to other hotels. Although the breakfast room was slightly underfurnished we had no problems getting a table, but in very busy times it could be a struggle. Would be happy to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Rowena8
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic, 5 mins walk from the walk of fame and so many of the sites of Hollywood. Easy walk to the subway and bus stops. The service was great with the staff always happy to help and give directions etc. The rooms were reasonably sized (we had a room with two double beds) and the beds were comfy. The continental breakfast was a lot better than expected, with eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, yoghurt, muffins, cereal etc on offer. All in all, our stay was excellent and even better considering the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Hollywood; Gloomy Room”
Reviews.Author: Rammer12
Reviews.Content: Located close to all the major sites in Hollywood. We had a king room on the 6th floor that was more like a dungeon. It had a small 2'x3' window above head height that looked out under a stair at a wall. The HVAC unit sounded like a freight train and the bed was sagging in several places. Internet was sketchy at best. All in all, this made for a very unpleasant two nights. Adding to this was our gross disappointment with the "sights of Hollywood". Nothing here I would want to see again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for Price”
Reviews.Author: RaeDudley
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay there again. It was clean and nice and what you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet, good service”
Reviews.Author: Redbird48
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I spent two nights here and was very pleased. We all stayed in one room with two queen beds and there was plenty of room for all of us. The location is only two blocks from Grauman's Chinese Theater, the Walk of Fame and the Hollywood Highlands (which had great restaurants and shopping). Valet parking was $20 per day and well worth it. We did not use our car and walked everywhere. Free breakfast was included which was on the fourth floor which was where our room was. The desk clerks were extremely nice and helpful. They recommended places to eat and answered all our questions. Internet service worked perfectly plus we noticed a computer open to the public on our floor. Only one slight problem - the tv remote would not work - but someone was sent up and he promptly fixed it. Despite being in the hubble of downtown Hollywood, the room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Aly0808
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 days in August and had a pleasant stay. Certainly great value for the location. Large rooms were kept clean & the staff were mostly helpful. Breakfast was ok, the famed warm cinnamon rolls really were delicious. . would have been great if they were available for afternoon tea! Having free wi-fi was a bonus when choosing this hotel, but I found the strength and reliability so bad that I didn't bother to use the internet until I found a computer shop and bought a cheap ethernet cable to plug directly into the phone line. After that internet access was fantastic... fast and reliable. They also only have 1 washing machine and 1 drier, so get in quick :) I would definitely stay there again... value for money hotel in great spot. Close to public transport to get you anywhere you want to go (as a couple of days in the Hollywood Blvd area is quite enough).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - but its OK”
Reviews.Author: Bridgey423000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic and would have been ok if the volcano hadnt blown on our second day and our three day stay was extended to 9 nights. Not really the fault of the hotel! But boy we were over Hollywood, plastic breakfasts and your'e welcome by the time leaving day came. Staff were generally friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in an excellent location, 5...”
Reviews.Author: popkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, 5 min walk from walk of Fame! Close to all bus and subways. We had 4 people in 1 room and had plenty of space, rooms were very clean and tidy. Reception were always happy to help with any queries. Free wifi in hotel, signal wasn't always great but can't complain as it's free :) there were free pc's to use also. Only negative thing would be the parking is $20 per day, they don't have self parking, only valet! Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: silent_ibis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, the rooms are clean and well-equipped (with fridges, safes, and free wi-fi), and the staff is amongst the friendliest and most helpful that I’ve ever encountered. I would have preferred not to have had to pay the $22 a day parking fee – though, comparatively speaking, it’s not an unreasonable rate -- and getting back into the hotel’s parking lot can be a bit of a challenge, given that it can require turning left across three busy lanes of North Highland Avenue traffic, but all in all I couldn’t have been happier with my five-night stay in late July.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Alejandra_73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Inn Express from Sep 23 to 30. We couldn't be happier! The check-in was quick, and we got our room with two queen beds, as booked; the room was pretty comfortable, it had a convenient safe and a cool massage shower, besides a complimentary coffee machine and coffee. The free WI-FI, nice addition. If you need to book a tour, you can use the room phone, since all local calls are free! (for my surprise!) The complimentary breakfast was pretty good, including the USA Today every morning. Please note since it is an Express hotel, they use plastic tableware, which for us was not a problem at all! besides, the breakfast was just delicious! specially the coffee! The staff was really pleasant and helpful! and most of them speak Spanish. Also, the hotel is walking distance from the Hollywood Blvd (3-5 minutes approx.), where all the main attractions are located: the Kodak Theatre, The Chinese theatre, the Walk of Fame, Madame tussauds´s museum, Ripley´s, and so much more. Also, most tours depart just from the Chinese theatre, which is very convenient. Since we preferred to use the public transportation to move around, I must say the Metro station is exactly in the Hollywood Blvd. and Highland Avenue. The bus stop is also there. it was really easy to move around. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1624
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, it is well located about 5 mins walk from Hollywood Blvd, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Madame Tussauds Wax Museum and the The Hollywood Highland Centre (Restaurants, some shops). The Hollywood Bowl is I'd say about a 20 min walk away a lot of people were parking near the hotel and walking there. If you are planning on doing tours with Starline Tours these also leave from Grauman's Chinese Theatre, you can arrange a pick up from your hotel but as they visit quite a few hotels it might add another hour or two onto your day, it was easy to be able to walk there. You can also jump on the subway from Hollywood Blvd to Unviersal Studios which is about two stops away, then you walk across the road and get a shuttle up the hill to Universal Studios. We thought about walking and Im so glad we didn't as it was quite steep and was a lot further than I thought it would be.We got a taxi back that evening as we were so tired and it was about $20 I think to the hotel. We enjoyed this hotel, the rooms were clean, a little darkish but great for sleeping. we had a Queen Executive suite 2x Queen beds and a double sofa, as we were traveling with 2 Adults and 3 teenagers this suited us perfectly and allowed us to have just the one room which although cosy saved us a lot of $$. We booked direct on the Holiday inn site and got a great advance rate of $195.00 , I asked to be on a high floor due to trip advisor reviews I had read about the street noise. The air conditioner was quite noisy but we got used to it and were so tired from our daily adventures we went straight to sleep each night. The boys had a dip in the pool one day and used the gym a few times. Beds were very comfy, even the sofa bed.The room had a mini fridge, coffee machine, free Wi Fi but that didn't work very well at times but was free. Breakfast was also included which was great as we usually didn't want lunch so saved the cost of two meals. The breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon, bagels, muffins, yoghurt, fruit, cereals, juice tea and coffee. Staff were always pleasant and helpful, you also get a free USA today newspaper which you pick up in the foyer. There is a laundry on the 3rd floor but only has one machine and dryer but was really handy. Across the road from the hotel is Pizza Shop, Subway and a mini mart which was well stocked and not too outrageously priced . The last day of our stay we discovered a pharmacy/supermarket on Hollywood Blvd about one block past the Chinese Theatre it wasn't huge but was cheaper than the mini mart for snacks. The area was a little dirty and some strange characters around but we had no problem the whole time we were there. The only issue we had and it wasn't with the hotel, they seem to use a private taxi service (un metered) I guess they get some kick back. So if you want a metered cab make sure you stipulate that. The private cab we had took us to our next hotel in Venice Beach ($80) which was fine. We mentioned that we were going to the airport in two days and he asked us if he could take us, we had to be picked up at 5.20am. He gave us his number and we confirmed the night before by phone with him. Well he didn't show up and at that time of morning it was hard to get a 5 seater cab, fortunately we were lucky and still made our flight. I can't find the card with his name on it but when I do I will add his name to this review. Like I said nothing really to do with the hotel other than they use his service. This hotel is well situated, clean, friendly and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: leylandii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 2 minutes of the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The hotel staff were very pleasant, the hotel was clean and tidy, easy to find, reasonably quiet and the complimentary breakfast was extremely good.The Metro is a 2 minute walk away and downtown LA is about 8 stops away (15 - 20 min ride)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with hotel - hollywood is a dive though!”
Reviews.Author: anne_groves
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - very clean; had fridge, microwave, coffee making facilities; staff were friendly and very helpful; had free parking (quite a rarity for this area!); also had free buffet breakfast which was very reasonable quality food; hotel is located just around the corner from the Walk of Fame and sunset boulevard. Hollywood came as quite a shock though - it is rough and dirty! Looked like a slum. The hotel organised a 2 hour tour for us of the Hollywood hills (the stars homes), Beverley hills, and Rodeo Drive; the tour cost about $35 and was definitely worth the money - you got to see the nicer (very rich) parts - although sunset boulevard is a dump as well ! Would recommend Universal Studios - although expensive it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Main shopping and attractions....”
Reviews.Author: janetdib
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to USA that was completed with a 1 night/2 day stay in West Hollywood. We chose this hotel because of the price and location and was not disappointed with the hotel and its ammenities. The rooms are large enough for a small stay(we had 2 QS beds) and was clean with large flat screen tv and free internet. Breakfast was the best we had in the whole trip with eggs, bacon, cereal, toast, coffee etc.... Early checkin was not available even though I requested it prior, however they did let us store our luggage while we went out sightseeing. My main complaint would be, that even though I emailed 3 times and rang the hotel before leaving Australia, to ask if we could remain in our room until 9pm as our flight never left until 11.30pm that night it was not granted. I was happy to pay for a half day rate but was told I would have to pay for a full night if I wanted to stay in the room. This meant that once again we had to leave our luggage stored while we went to Universal studios for the day. We had to fill in the rest of our day as best we could and given it was so hot on this day, it was a huge inconvenience to us. It woud have been nice to come back shower and rest before our long flight home. We had to settle for getting changed in a small toilet area and when i asked if they could give us some face washers we could use I was given a small bar of soap to use between the 4 of us...Im sure in such a large hotel it wouldnt have been too hard to find some towels for us..Other than that it was a great hotel in a great location!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: 186337bernie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights from Sept 10th and booked it due to the TA reviews - it more than matched our expectations. All the staff are friendly and helpful, particulary reception. The room was a good size and was kept immaculately clean by very conscientious cleaning ladies. The breakfast was very good and Marietta the breakfast lady was cheerful and ensured the food was plentiful and coffee/tea always hot and available. The hotel is well situated for Hollywood Boulevard. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Excellent location and a Brilliant base for exploring LA”
Reviews.Author: darraghke
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here from September 7th until 14th 2010. Room is of good size with good facilities. Good TV, good size bathroom and the air conditioning worked very well. The location was fantastic. Just down the road form the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Centre and the Walk of Fame. We rented a car for our stay and from the Hotel it was very easy to access other parts of Los Angeles. We could easily travel to the beaches, Beverley Hills, Disneyland Anaheim and Universal Studios from the hotel. the brekfast every morning was excellent. I went down every morning and brought back brekfast for two of us to the room. As soon as something runs out it is replaced, Reception staff were very nice and also the car valet people were nice.Cleaners did a thorough job also. Free WIFI was a major plus aswell as most hotels require you to pay for it. It was handy to be able to log onto the WIFI on my phone to check emails from the comfort of my room. There is a swimming pool available but I didnt see many people use as there is so much to do in LA no need to waste a day at the pool but it is good to have the option also a fitness centre to keep the fitness up while on holiday is a great option to have. Next time we are back in California we hope to be able to stay at this brilliant hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: ACTTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: We started our 3 week USA trip in Hollywood. Check in was a breeze, our room overlooked the pool. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast is a great bonus with a good basic choice and really yummy cinnamon rolls. We loved the pool and used it several times as it was around 27C while we were there. The location is wonderful, 10 minutes to the Highland centre, we loved the hop on hop off buses. The staff were friendly and professional. Thank you for a great start to our holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amypritchard224
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our honeymoon. We had a King Executive Suite at the front of the hotel. Large room with great facilities, such as fridge, microwave, etc. Small problem was the light outside of the window was very bright and the air-conditioner was noisy!! Cant complain though because was lovely big room. Perfect location for walk of fame and Hollywood and Highland shopping centre. We ate here every night- only 5 minute walk from the hotel, and has varied food choices with wide range of prices. We used the hotel to help us book our tours, which included Universal Studios (go on the whole day tour to here!) and the Whole City tour which included the beaches (Venice, Muscle Beach, Santa Monica) downtown LA, walk of fame (stopped here for lunch), stars home, hollywood sign, etc. This was with LA City Tours- they were very organised and there office is right on the walk of fame. They pick you up from your hotel and drop you at the office to then get on the right bus for the excursion. Each bus picked up from one area, not based on where you were going- that was what was sorted when we got to the office- saved driving around lots of the city pickin people up! Very impressed with this!!! On our first day we also booked our own tour of Sid Grauman's theatre, the Kodak theatre, etc. We were initially put off by the reports that the breakfast is served on paper plates. Considering the quality, price and location of hotel if this small feature ruins your holiday your too picky!!! I dont even think I would have noticed if hadnt read it on here before i left!! The breakfast is nice- nothing fancy but ideal for a meal before a whole day of sightseeing!!

Reviews.Title: “A great base for Hollywood sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: kattie40
Reviews.Content: Travelled from the UK with our 2 children. We were really pleased with the room - considering how close we were to Hollywood Blvd it was very quiet (and comfortable). The staff were all very friendly and helpful (especially the lady who runs the breakfast). Breakfast was great - a good range of food for adults/children and we like the self service arrangement. As previously mentioned the pool area is quite small with only a couple of loungers but, to be fair, we didn't come to Hollywood to sit by a pool!! Walking to the walk of fame takes only 5 mins - we felt safe and had no concerns with being out at night. We loved our daytrip to Universal which was a short drive away. Would definitely recommend using a car to get around as we took in many famous sights that we might have otherwise missed. Would highly recommend this hotel as a great base in Hollywood. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better.”
Reviews.Author: bwistle
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the best hotel in Hollywood for its price. It is close to Hollywood Blvd, which is where everything happens, it has the metro which can easily take you to Universal studios for $1.50. I was a bit worried about staying in Hollywood as I hear it was seedy and dangerous at night. It wasn't. We saw maybe 1 or 2 homeless people, bits of Hollywood are a tad seedy, but its part of the experience. Its not dangerous, I felt safe, me being a woman, and went out quite a bit at night (although it didn’t get dark till about 8-9pm). Hollywood Highland complex is full of places to eat and shop, and Hollywood Blvd has a lot of shops too. Just don’t get tours through the hotel, they’re very expensive, get tours on the walk of fame, these a usually very cheap. The room at the hotel, was big, spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel also had a good pool, gym and the breakfast was great. It had cereal, bacon, egss ect, and the woman working there (Maria i think?) was one of the nicest people there. The only problem is trying to get to disnyland, we didnt end up going as we had no car. This was a great 4 night stay and would definitely go back. Thanks Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel. Just a walk from Hollywood Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: dazbrads
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel. Close to ( short 5min walk from ) Hollywood Blvd. Nice basic breakfast. Hotel/rooms have been updated. Big widescreen TV in room! Comfortable room. Valet parking man very friendly. Reception staff helpful. Enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: deetrick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, I was really impressed. It was only one block away from the Kodak Theatre and all the restaurants. Everything was in walking distance. The hotel itself was very clean and was very quite, we heard no street noise at all. I would highly recommend this hotel especially on price and value. I will be staying here every time I'm in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireDaws
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days and was extremely pleased. The rooms were basic but clean. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd and a 5 minute drive to Universal Studios so is an ideal base for all tourists. The breakfast was a bonus for the price of the stay and the receptionists were the most hepful staff we have encountered. What more can I say, an ideal hotel that I would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: sarit68
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the room size and the service. Very friendly staff and located in a prime area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Chyla1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean from all aspects of it. Very accomodating staff and quick responses to all needs. The room (2 Queens) was very large and comfortable for our 4 night stay. Location was a quick walk to the walk of fame and a great spot to be central in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Mother/daughter trip - Excellent place to stay in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: MALEW44
Reviews.Content: For my daughter's 16th birthday (last week), I took her to Hollywood, CA. Because we'd never been to L.A./Hollywood (we live in Houston, TX), I started my hotel search from scratch. We knew we wanted to be within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd to see all of the amazing sights. I found the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites - Hollywood Walk of Fame online. The website really caught my attention (BTW, we love the song that plays on the website by Kascade), and believe it or not, I read ALL 251 reviews about the hotel. The website was very informative regarding accomodations and price, so I booked it. I had a couple of additional questions, so I called the hotel directly, and was provided the additional information - Thank you for that! We arrived around 10:30 a.m., however check in is at 3:00 p.m. This wasn't a problem at all. The young lady at the front desk was very helpful (she actually remembered talking to me on the phone), she offered to watch our luggage while we walked over to Hollywood & Highland Center for lunch. (Note: we felt VERY safe walking around in that area - EVEN AT NIGHT! ) When we returned, we checked in to our rooms, which looked EXACTLY like the pictures on the internet. Very modern, large flat screen T.V., refridgerator, etc. The complimentary breakfast was absolutely delicious. We knew we wanted to "venture" out and go to Universal Studios, 6 Flags Magic Mountain, Rodeo Dr, Venice Beach, etc., and we knew we couldn't walk, so we used the private car service provided right there at the hotel - "Daniel". WOW !!!!!!! This guy is AMAZING!!!!! Daniel was extremely courteous and very polite. Fabulous "customer service"!!! He's very knowledgeable of the Los Angeles/Hollywood area, so he was able to recommend great things to do and places to visit. My 16 year old daughter can be a little "indecisive" at times, and she changes her mind in a moment's notice (sigh), but Daniel never complained about last minute changes or detours. - THANK YOU DANIEL FOR MAKING HER 16TH BIRTHDAY A MEMORABLE ONE!!!! And thank you to the entire Holiday Inn Express (Hollywood) staff for your warm welcome to Hollywood and your wonderful customer service. Although we stayed for 4 days, it wasn't nearly enough time to do it all. We will DEFINITELY be returning in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Kippur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a walk away from the Hollywood Walk of fame, Kodak Theatre and Chinese theatre. It is also a short walk from the Hollywood Bowl. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the car parking service efficient. Only negative is the receptionist who kept on plugging the local tours. Tip: get a $6 dollar daily travel pass [you can get from the metro station by the Kodak Theatre] and get a map with the bus routes on from the info kiosk in the entrance to the shopping centre leading up to the Kodak Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Tommie69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased with our choice. We did not have a car but we found the hotel very well located being a 5-10 minute stroll to the Chinese Theatre area. From here we were able to pick up the metro and also the hop on hop off bus tour and therefore able to visit all the areas we wished. This area seems to have improved since I was last there 19 years ago and we felt safe walking to and from the hotel. The free breakfast was excellent (especially the cinnamon buns!) and we certainly agree that the lady who supervises this area is very friendly and efficient - maybe a tip box could be set out in the dining area for her? The only downer was the noise. We were located on the 3rd floor and were under the breakfast area and next to the laundry and the churning ice machine (I hope this was not because we had used HI priority points) Would choose this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Iliana13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to hollywood boulevard. Rooms were big and clean. Nice mattress. Breakfast was outstanding. Did not go to pool but saw others in it. We had a 5th floor room and did not have a great view but did not spend too much time in room. Business center has one computer with internet access. Small store in lobby sells drinks and microwavable items. Valet parking required during the summer. $20.00 daily parking fee added to checkout bill. Would recommend but wish it were cheaper. Considering the other hotel prices in the area it was not bad. My husband did not think much of the gym and walked over to the LA fitness on Hollywood boulevard instead. No fee if you are a member.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineLollypop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HI early May at the start of our 4 week holiday in California. I did alot of research prior to booking this accommodation and was extremely pleased with my choice! We had a speedy check-in and received a courtsey call from Reception once in the room to check we found the room ok (nice touch!). Our room was on the top floor and was very spacious and super clean. It was also quite which was a big plus (esp. after arriving in after a long flight). The breakfast was great and saved us heaps money (make sure you try their famous cinnamon rolls - they were yum!). Another great feature of this Hotel is the free internet - very handy and available 24/7. And last but not least, the location was perfect. Just a short, safe walk to Hollywood Bvld and it's attractions as well as the sub station where you can get the train to Universal Studios etc. This hotel was value for money and I would go as far as saying the cleanest hotel during our stay in California (and we stayed at some big name Hotels).

Reviews.Title: “great choice for hollywood”
Reviews.Author: dahne15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of july, 2 adults and 3 teenagers. We had a great stay, lovely big rooms (although a little noisy with traffic), a great pool, never very busy, and a wonderful breakfast area. just get there early if you want a table. The breakfast lady was lovely as were all the staff. We felt very safe walking about day and night . Only 5 mins walk to walk of fame and shops etc, also there was a friendly subway just across the road from the hotel.... excellent all round.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mz_Sonia
Reviews.Content: My group of 4 stayed here for 4 nights in early July. The hotel location is perfect - it's only a 2 min walk to the Highland Center and to the Walk of Fame. There are also some shops right across the road which may come in handy - Subway, a few little restaurants, and a convenience store. The hotel is also only a 5 min drive to Universal Studios. We found out room to be good for a 3 star hotel - the rooms were renovated and looked quite modern and large enough to fit the 4 of us and our multiple suitcases. We really enjoyed breakfast at this hotel - when I read contintental breakfast, I was expecting (from previous experience at past hotels) just a few pastries, fruit and juice. But there was scrambled eggs, bacon, yoghurt, cereals, bagels, pastries, fruit, breads and beverages. Obviously the selection wasn't huge, but it was more than satsifactory to fill us up and give us energy for our long sightseeing-filled days. We also really liked the service at this hotel. Both the front desk staff and the valet staff were more than happy to help in giving us reccomendations, booking cars and shuttles for us and, in general, they seemed like they were genuinely enjoying just chatting to you. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, as it's location makes it perfect as a base from which to see the LA area, and it's quite good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and pleasant hotel. Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: fischclan5
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and it's always difficult to get rooms that fit five easily for a good price. This Holiday Inn express provides that. The queen beds are comfortable and the sofa sleeper seems bigger than other hotels we've stayed in. It's a two block walk to the Walk of Fame and Highland shopping center and just a 5 minute drive to Universal. The only downside is turning North out of the hotel or turning into the hotel. Traffic makes it a little difficult. The free hot/continental breakfast in the morning is very good and the lady who works it is very good at her job. She keeps everything full and cleans tables as soon as someone leaves. I would without a doubt stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “"Hotel No. 3 on our Honeymoon-round-the world-trip! Great for getting a quick idea about L.A."”
Reviews.Author: Joe0202
Reviews.Content: To be honest I found it quite difficult to pick the right hotel in L.A. if it is the first time you go there. We where looking for a central location which enables us to have quick access to major attractions as we only stayed 2 nights. For this the Holiday Inn Express was a great choice. It was easy to find by car, parking was good (would be even better for free/included in hotel price), rooms were very clean and enough of space and the service was very friendly. It was a short walk to the Walk of Fame and the Graumans Chinese Theater. By car it was easy to drive into the Hollywood Hills and to the Sunset Blvd. By underground we went to Downtown and see the Disney Concert Hall (which you shouldn't miss) and in the other direction to the Universal studio (which is not a problem if you miss it). The hotel pool was nice, but in december anyway not the right time to go for a swim. If you wanna spend some time at the pool I would recommend a hotel with roof top pool. Only negative was the breakfast. Beside the fact that it was very basic we found it's horrible how much waste is produced by all this plastic plates, cups etc. We believe more commitment to sustainability would be great!"

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BoDK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. 2 adults and 3 children in one room. The room was nice and clean and the breakfast was excellent. The pool was a bit small, but still nice. The hotel is placed in a nice and safe neighborhood in walking distance from Walk of Fame. We never felt unsecure on the streets in the evening, even with small kids. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel for service, cleanliness, breakfast and location!”
Reviews.Author: janesw
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our children aged 9 and 15. Hotel 30 mins from LAX in cab. Room excellently appointed and clean and spacious. Bathroom great. All service with a smile. Hot and cold breakfast which suited the children. Free parking. Location 5 minutes walk literally from shopping mall and chinese theatre, walk of fame etc. Californian Pizza Kitchen restaurant in the mall, also Grill but we thought expensive. Pool small but very clean. Couldn't have had a better start to a 3 week driving tour of california.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: creativetampabay
Reviews.Content: Front desk was nice, free breakfast was good and you are 5 blocks from main Hollywood walk of fame - good location - clean room - decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: markhomer
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, rooms were great. staff were polite and helpful, nothing is not too much trouble for them. The location is extremely near to the hollywood bowl and 10 minutes walk from the walk of fame and both the chinese and kodak theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for taking in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AZFamilyOf4
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel with our teenage boys as we explored Hollywood. We booked a room on the executive level. The location was perfect for us. Major Hollywood attractions - Chinese theatre, Madame Toussad's wax museum, Hollywood Bowl, etc are all within easy 5 minute walking distance which saves a lot of driving/parking hassle. Our room was very clean and comfortable, with a nice flat panel TV. The included free WiFi was a helpful bonus. Some have complained about the noise from the busy street outside, but we did not find it to be a problem. The two double beds were soft and comfy. Our accommodations included a free breakfast with bacon, eggs, cereal, danishes, etc. which is a nice value for families. Although the room rate was a bit more than we are used to paying at Holiday Inn, we were pleased with the value and would definitely stay here again when visiting this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: szkut
Reviews.Content: We used here as a place to stay while in LA for a week. And it was great! We managed to get around all parts of LA quite easy from here. Great breakfast every morning, while we also made use of the pool and gym facilities. Could not fault anything whilst staying here. For the great price and location it was great for our week stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value if you want to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigal000
Reviews.Content: Good points: Very clean, nice decor, nice complimentary breakfast, nice pool, free computer use, good value, very central in LA for public transport (metro bus & trains 5 minutes walk away) if do not have a car, very handy to Hollywood Walk of fame, Madame Tausands Wax museum, Ripleys Believe it or not, theatres etc (5 minutes walk) & Universal studios (10 minutes by local bus @ $1.50 ea way). Will look after bags if check out early & pick up later. Seemed to have a nice clientele - lots of friendly people from Europe, Canada and Australia staying there, many families. Negative points: Room was very stuffy because windows do not open much. Many rooms only look into a wall (not good if claustraphobic!) Busy street - traffic very noisy - we had to turn on the air conditioner all night so it would drown out the road noise. Police sirens, helicopters & fire engines much of the night. Hollywood is generally quite a seedy area - lots of homeless people, beggars & weirdos wandering about, but most of LA seems to be like that these days! I noticed that the Magic Castle Hotel, very nearby, is on a quieter street and gets very good reviews, but it charges a lot more. Recommend eating at The California Pizza restaurant, upstairs on the corner of Hollywood & Highland. Greek Pizza scrumptious. Recommend not booking any LA tours until you arrive as they offer lots of discount vouchers in the main street, as well as deals for seeing multiple attractions, such as a tour plus wax museum. This hotel was also selling two day passes to Universal studios for the price of 1 day (but note that it is much cheaper to take local bus than to buy a pass that includes transport). We did La City Tour A1 - Venice Beach (very, very seedy & dangerous at night), Santa Monica Beach, Dowtown including oldest house in LA, Hollywood, then Movie Stars houses in Beverly Hills etc. A good way to see a great deal of LA in one day. But be aware that if you initially get a crappy seat on their mini bus they make you stay in the same one all day even though you paid as much as the people in the front row (good reason not to give a tip to tour guide who insists on noboby moving seats!) We also took the local bus (Dash Hollywood @ 25cents each) to the Beverly Centre shopping mall - there are also Outlet stores across the road at "The Beverly Connection" - designer shoes, handbags, clothes at greatly reduced prices.

Reviews.Title: “A great haven from the crazy Hollywood scene!”
Reviews.Author: ctrink
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the wonderful complementary breakfast. The breakfast hostess is one of the hardest workers we have come upon in our travels. She has been in the breakfast room on all 3 trips to this location. Her organization and presntation are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Value and Convenience in Central Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Kenat323
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to central Hollywood (and the Hollywood Bowl) and better value than some of the nearby competition. The included breakfast is terrific, with both traditional and healthier options. The pool is nice enough, though not particularly pretty (can they spare a potted palm or something?). The views of Whitley Heights are stunning. Although I’m American (and lived in Hollywood for a decade), I liked the international flavor of the guests. My biggest complaint is the $20 daily parking charge; it takes away from the value pricing. I recommend dropping stuff off and parking on the street (but read the signs) or in a cheaper lot nearby. As my wife and I arrived separately in two cars, the hotel parking was out of the question. We walked to the other end of Hollywood Boulevard for a nice French dinner at the W---but be careful of the W’s downright unAmerican 25% service charge on meals and drinks. Other restaurants are closer--like Mussos and Franks, and a cool looking Latin American place (both on the Boulevard). For the 20 somethings, a number of ’hip" clubs are within walking (or short taxi) distance. But don’t overlook the traditional and more divey (yet safe) bars like Boardners and the Frolic Room. There’s a shopping mall down the block from the hotel which was (and is) a huge disappointment to locals, except for the Kodak Theatre (for the Oscars etc.) But some of the foreign visitors seem to like what seems to us a bizarre collection of merchandise on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitly be back”
Reviews.Author: mklove2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Hollywood on our last trip to LA and we will definitly be back. It is centrally located to many attractions including a short walk to the hollywood walk of fame and its many attractions. It's great to have a variety of affordable places to eat in the vacinity. It was about a 5min walk down the hill. I would recommend a car rental if you intend to visit Santa Monica Pier, Burbank, Universal City, Venice Beach, etc. However the hotel does provide a variety of tour options. The only downside to our stay was that the pool was closed for its annual maintenance, but that was outside of their control. I also thought there was going to be a microwave in our room based on the description online, but there wasn't. Our room was quite, but a bit of a hike as you have to take two seperate elevators to get to the 8th floor as the hotel is built on a hill. There was a fridge in our suite, a safe which is really handy and I liked that there was a table in our room so we could get our breakfast in our suite. The beds and pillows were by far the most comfortable sleep I have had in a hotel in a long time...FABULOUS! The staff was friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was a great way to fuel up to start the day. We will definitly be staying here on our next trip back. Great value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lojoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Great location to wander Hollywood Blvd. I will have to admit we weren't expecting much from Hollywood due to other reviews but we had a wonderful time! My 13 year old daughter loved everything about it. We saw only 1 or 2 homeless people, who bothered no one. On our walking tour the guide said that they have been revitalizing the area now for 10-15 years, we were very happy with it. The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring, we went to Griffith Park, Warner Bros. and Paramount Studio tours (paramount highly recommended), Beverly Hills, and others all within a 1/2 hour drive (yes we did take on the LA traffic, not so bad). So much to see and do. Hotel clean and people friendly, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our week long stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers75
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic start to our wonderful 4 week holiday in America! This hotel is minutes away from all the action and the metro line. We walked to and from Hollywood Blvd regularly while we stayed there and made use of the public transport (metro and buses) with absolutely no problems. We thoroughly enjoyed our week long stay at this hotel as the room was big and very clean and the bed was comfy. The staff were always friendly and happy to help with any questions and the other amenities (breakfast, business centre and laundry) were great as well. We would definitely recommend this to anyone holidaying in Hollywood. We had a brilliant week there and would definitely stay there again if we're lucky enough to get back there for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Its good - very very good !!”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home after a two week break in the US. I am a Platinum Elite member of Intercontinental Hotels loyalty programme and while I may get more benefits staying at an Intercontinental or Crowne Plaze, I always choose to stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Hollywood. Its modern, exceptionally clean, has a great location and I think the best staff of any hotel I have ever stayed at in Los Angeles. I was greeted on arrival by Jen, who was in training. Jen is going to be a real asset to this hotel. The breakfast lady was her cheerful self, along with the valet guys and the housekeeping girls. While some people complain about paying $22 for parking, believe me, this is cheap. I had just driven up from San Francisco where I was paying $60 a night for hotel parking in the city. Free Internet was good, along with laundry facilities, but the only down side was some people seem to take all their laundry away on holiday and do it in the hotel laundry judging by the amount of time the machines were in use. So in essence, the HIE Hollywood is great for my needs and I will use them exclusively whenever I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, conveniently placed”
Reviews.Author: Bazza1951_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value hotel within easy striking distance of Hollywood Walk and the Metro Rail system then you should consider this hotel. While it's a no frills hotel, fixtures are modern and stylish, rooms are a good size and clean, beds are comfortable. We were placed on the side away from North Highland Avenue, so traffic noise was minimal. However, this may be an issue for rooms facing the Avenue (busy all the time). Breakfast is adequate and inclusive in the room charge, A small but extremely helpful addition for those who have been on the road for a while is a guest laundry (machine & dryer). Internet (business centre) is free and available 24/7. Staff is helpful & friendly (especially the breakfast room attendant).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: Cobole81
Reviews.Content: We Book 2 rooms for the jazz festival it was in walking distance. The hotel is celan and room was on the 8th floor, room was big for our family. The breakfast lady was great in re stocking the breakfast bar. The hotel staff are Nice Will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philjack
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 great weeks in the US visiting New York, Frisco, Vegas & LA. We were very disapointed with this hotel. We spent 4 sleepless nights here due to the noise from the 6 lanes of 24 hour traffic directly below our third floor window. We booked into a suite, the room was large and the bed comfortable but that's the last of the good news. It was dark,dingy and smelt musky. The only benefit of it being a suite was a fridge, coffee maker, and a sink. there were no kitchen facilities, cuttlery, or utensills. If you are used to staying in half decent accomodation then you will be disapointed despite the mysterious amount of good reviews on this site! This worked out to be the most expensive hotel we stayed at with charges that I had somehow missed when making our booking? like the $33.60 "city tax" that brought the total cost of a room for a Friday night with parking to $295.99.(inc tax)!! Oh the breakfast is free!! If you are visiting LA then don't bother staying in Hollywood - it is a dirty dump that you can cover as a tourist in half a day. When out and about you can not help but notice the amount of homeless people that sleep in open pavement areas. If I were to return to LA I would deffinately not stay at the Holiday Inn or any other hotel in Hollywood I would probably opt for the Santa Monica area - much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff; air in room caused a problem”
Reviews.Author: beachbuddy7
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year back to this hotel for the Playboy Jazz Festival. Hotel is within walking distance to the Hollywood Bowl. Marieta, Breakfast Manager, remembers us each year and takes great pride in keeping the breakfast area stocked and cleaned. Breakfasts are always the best thing going at this hotel. 4 months ago we made reservations and asked for a suite on the 8th floor. Upon checking in we were given a 5th floor room on busy N. Highland Blvd. We were able to open up the window partly overnight and upon waking up both of us felt nauseous, maybe from the street fumes. Being outside after breakfast we had no problems. The next night we closed the window and used the air conditioner and experienced the same nauseous feeling when we awore. When we left the hotel and got into the fresh air, we both felt better. Next year we will ask for a side or back room or a suite on the 6-8 floors hoping that will take care of the air problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: GillnBuck
Reviews.Content: We looked through lots of other tripadvisor reviews and finally decided on this one for location and price. LA is quite diificult to work out where you want to base yourself as its a sprawling city and we were only there for a couple of days but we found this hotel perfect. Just a short walk to the Hollywood walk of fame and metro stop plus the sighseeing buses. We found our hotel room spotlessly clean and comfortable. Only slight downside our room was at the rear near an aircon generator which was a little noisey but didn't really spoil our stay. The rooms are well eqipped, no coffe making machine but free coffee/tea was available in reception 24hrs.The complimentary breakfast was just fine and better than anticipated, eggs,bacon selection cereals, croisants juices. Shame about the paper plates and plastic cutlery though. There are laundry facilities and a nice small pool area. We used the airport shuttle service (supershuttle) which was really good value and worked out simple and well organised. We used the tourist bus to get an over view of the city and spent some time at Venice beach which was lovely. We also used the metro and went to Union station (beautifil and good for people watching) and then on the Gold line to Little Tokyo (great places for lunch)/Mexico quarter. In the evenings we were always shattered and did not want to stroll far for dinner but found California Pizza Kitchen in the nearby shopping precinct, found this good value and they made a quality Margarita. All in all found our hotel the perfect base for a short stopover in LA. The staff were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frogonastick
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with large rooms if I ever travel to LA again, I'm staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: UsaBrad
Reviews.Content: From the garage attendent, the front desk, to the people who take care of the rooms, you will find courteous, helpful people. The room we had was large, excellent bathroom, and fine towels. The free breakfast was adequate. Say hello to Marieta, in the breakfast room. She keeps the place well stocked and clean as a whistle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean great location”
Reviews.Author: shebbablue01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 7 nights here and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, rooms were spacious and you didn't really get the feeling of being in a hotel. However should you wish to do any washing you may need to stand in line as there was only 1 guest laundry located on the third floor as the one on the fifth no longer available. We would recommend this hotel as it is in a great location, 5 minute walk to Hollywood Blv and the walk of Fame etc. Thank you for a great holiday. ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hollywood Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonLinda
Reviews.Content: We checked in late on Tthursday night, coming from Arizona. The front desk staff had our keys ready and had even upgraded us to a 2 bed suite. The rooms were large and clean...and beds were heaven! The breakfast is good but just skip it if you're later than 8am, ast he breakfast room gets pretty crowded. The location here is great and there's so much to see within walking distance. Finding a good meal is simple at their location. Valet parking made our check-in and -out really easy, with excellent service. My only complaint is the Hollywood traffic! Leave extra time to get to your meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Jsaint
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room with my mother in March and it was a perfect base to explore LA. After a very long flight from Australia check in was quick and the lady at reception was very welcoming. We were happy to see two queen beds in a massive room that had an equally large bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the room was nice and clean. The location in Hollywood is fantastic, a 5 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd and all the Hollywood attractions. Great for shopping at the Hollywood & Highland complex and also easy access to the metro station and the tourist buses. Breakfast was substantial however the breakfast room does get full so we did take it back to our room a couple of times. Overall it was a great stay at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and So Central.”
Reviews.Author: LellyScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our teenage daughter stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I had noticed a couple of poor reviews about the holiday inn but most were good and I must say the room we stayed in was lovely. It looks like they have all recently been done up as everything was so clean and fresh looking. We had 2 king size beds, a large flat screen tv on a large chest of drawers. A big mirrored wardrobe containing iron, ironing board and spare bedding. A safe with a combination of your choice, sofa, dining room table, microwave, coffee maker and fridge. The bathroom had a hairdryer. The shower was so powerful, you didnt want to get out!!! Really beautifully furnished, the carpet was lovely and clean and of good quality. And obviously, the room had an air conditioned unit.. The cleaners came every day and changed the beds and towels, and also left the place spotless and tidy. The breakfast was very adequate, there was a hot area which had scrambled egg, bacon, hot scones and some other oaty thing!!! You have a large selection of bread, bagels muffins etc. A choice of fruit juices, tea and coffee. Yoghurts, cartons of milk...lots of choice. This was a fantastic hotel and I really would think seriously, if you wanted to stay in the center of Hollywood, stay in the Walk Of Fame. We were a 5 - 10 minute walk from the Kodak Theatre and a 5 minute car ride in the opposite direction to the Hollywood Bowl. When you walk out of the Hotel, you look to your left and you see the Hollywood sign. I can do nothing but sing this hotels praises.
