Yes, you have to pay $22 a night to park your car there, but as you are so close to the center, I think all hotels will charge. If I have to make a negative comment, it is that our room was at the front of the Hotel and the traffic is unrelenting 24hrs of the day. But there again, we only noticed it the first night because after that, we did so much sightseeing and walking, we were too tired at night to notice!! Right across the road from the Hotel, there are several shops including a Subway and a doughnut shop. Washing machines and tumble dryers are on all floors. There is also a swimming pool, spa, gym and a computer room. Absolutely brilliant, I couldnt have made a better choice of Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: KezzaJ_10
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous spacious rooms. Comfortable luxurious bed, large tv, equipped kitchen area. Staff went out of their way to help and were genuinely friendly and remembered who I was. Leisure centre ok but some equipment did not work. Breakfast excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood. Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: XR6PSI
Reviews.Content: On our travels through California most people told us to avoid LA and especially Hollywood but we loved it. It was the same with the hotel. Great location with great rooms. We got a standard King room which was large and spacious on the top floor with views over LA and the Hollywood sign. Id like to know how the suites look. The staff were overall good and as you would expect. The breakfast was good and plenty of time to get to it. Only things to watch for is that the higher floors require you to hunt down a different elevator which is kinda annoying. Watch the valet as well. Park the car yourself. All the spots are within a few steps of the elevator. The valet will literally move your car 20yards.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located for Hollywood Walk of Fame”
Reviews.Author: Wolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. Staff were friendly. Room large and clean. The free breakfast was the useall HIE deal: eggs (boiled or scrambled), toast, cereal, coffee, juice, fresh banana etc. We stayed in room 303; noise from the gym(?) upstairs filtered down through the ceiling from 7am to 11pm. Insist on a room other than 303 if noise worries you. The swimming pool is currently being serviced for summer. It is a 5 minute walk to the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre, Riples, Hollywood Museum etc. There is a big shopping centre close by called “Hollywood & Highland”. Across the road is a small market, Subway store and a really good Japanese resaturant called “Shintaro”. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MercurySandton
Reviews.Content: Found the location excellent and extremely clean and a good value breakfast. All locations in easy walking distance, park the car and leave it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Judith09_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only 2 minutes further way from the walk of fame than Renaisance hotel and half the price. The rooms were large and comfortable (especially the King) and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in Hollywood for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon in mid-March 2010. We were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to one of the suites on the upper levels on our arrival. This hotel is in a great location - only 5-10 minutes walk from Hollywood Blvd and the Kodak Center. We could also see part of the Hollywood sign from our bedroom window. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms, whilst fairly basic, were clean, a decent size and had everything we were looking for. This hotel also has a business center with free internet (you can print your boarding passes at reception), as well as breakfast included. Overall, whilst it wasn't flashy, we thought it represented great value and we would definitely stay there again. Tips: There is a decent Thai restaurant about a 20min walk along the boulevarde called The Palms. A lot of the hop on/hop off and movie star tours start near the Kodak Theatre - about a 10min walk from the hotel. There are a few food shops/pharmacy(i think)/convenience store which has alcohol and bits and pieces about 3min from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but be wary of noise issues”
Reviews.Author: smh66
Reviews.Content: Hotel is superbly located five mins walk from hollywood boulevard and the walk of fame. Hotel looks new, the rooms are a decent size and the beds are great. Reasonable parking on site and if eating out gets too much then there is a good store/Subway etc just across the road. Breakfast for a hotel of this class was really great and the lady running the breakfast room was lovely. Only issue we had was a bit of noise. Our room looked out over a next door hotel's parking lot and they had no qualms about firing up their noisy bus, right outside our room at 6am and letting it run for half an hour. Also our room was opposite the laundry and so 'thanks' go out to those girls who congregated there and chatted away at full volume whilst we tried to sleep and who also ignored our requests (twice) to please take their conversation elsewhere (perhaps their own room??). Don't these people realise that all those doors in the corridors are bedrooms at the end of the day? Of course being so close to the 'action' our saturday night was punctuated by significant noise from late night revellers (drunks) coming home at all hours. OK so these might not be directly the hotel's fault -there is no accounting for people, but maybe hotels should try and take some responsibilty - heck why not even put up a sign saying no noise after 10pm or something - it might be a start!

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT CLEAN AND GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ANGHARRAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a large room with 2 Queen size beds in April with our children aged 15 and 20. Despite window overlooking the road it was very quiet and plenty of room for the 4 of us.Breakfast was fine ~ a solitary banana was spotted on the first day but never seen again!! Excellent location for the Walk of fame and many sight seeing trips start outside the Chinese theatre which is only a ten min walk.The new underground is even closer and from the hotel to Universal Studios took about 40 mins. Had a very nice meal on Sunset Boulevard in a Brazillian restaurant called Bossa Nova which had a lovely atmosphere..It was very busy and a huge queue was waiting outside to be seated~ they appeared to be regular diners.Meal was very reasonable and good choice on the menu to suit everyone. As well as the Hollywood stars tour we also went on the new Gangland tour.Different !! They started in January and this was only their fifth tour with no previous experience in this field so it no doubt will evolve and some parts improved.However the highlight was definately listening to the gang members life histories and how they are now working to try and change the gang culture that is inherent in the poorer areas.Our children were enthralled and I would recommend the tour. LA is such a huge sprawling city but this hotel is ideal if you want to see the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you want to be stranded!!”
Reviews.Author: Brissie47
Reviews.Content: We paid in full and booked this hotel 3 months in advance. Our travel agent called and requested an early check in as we were travelling from Australia with a baby, this was promised to us. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greated by the hotel manager, hello people, lovely start!! After much saga and being promised a room the hotel manager told us we would need to wait until 3pm for a room, whilst in front of us he checked others without children into rooms. When we questioned why he would not give us a room he then started screaming are you calling me a liar that I have a room, then told us we were not welcome to stay at the hotel and he was too busy to give us a letter outlining we would be given a full refund. Stay next door at the Hollywood Heights they were brilliant and similar pricing!! The Hollywood Heights ended up calling the police for us as we had paid over $1000 for our stay and had nothing to say we would be refunded. The Police arrived and said to the manager not this again, obviously this is not the first time. The Police then spoke to the manager and came back and spoke to us, he said the manager thought we looked like party goers, very funny as we were travelling as a family with a 3yo, 15 yo and my mother 63yo. The police made them deliver a letter of refund to our new hotel. Don't risk not being welcome and book somewhere else. We did not get the refund for over 2 weeks, (Loads of hassles and phone calls) lucky we had enough money to pay for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for Hollywood as well as for the Metro to Universal”
Reviews.Author: Delight57
Reviews.Content: Standard Holiday Inn but well placed for all attractions and tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AnnPerthAustralia_wa
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing hollywood. Chinese theatre and walk of fame only round the corner within walking distance. Only about 10mins by car to Universal studios. Rooms where nice and modern and clean. Breakfast was ok but as it was the weekend we never got a table in the restaurant and where forced to take it back to the room to eat saying that it was free so better than nothing. There was also free coffee down at reception as well as vending machines.Suite was nice and roomy for a hotel only complaint and its not hotels fault was the traffic at night.It was noisy at times but then again its a major city so you have to accept that.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, good location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: scubadb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for the first stint of our our honeymoon last month. The location was great, its right near Hollywood & Highland but without the price tag of the Renaissance Hotel. The room was very clean, the bed was super comfortable and the shower was awesome. Nothing beats a hot shower with good water pressure after 17 hours of flying. The staff on reception were ok, and we had a early check in. The continental breakfast on the 4th floor was great too. All in all its a good hotel if you dont want to spend too much money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location For The Walk Of Fame”
Reviews.Author: SteveHammer
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting the Walk of Fame area of Hollywood this is an ideal location. The hotel itself is clean , tidy with reasonably sized rooms. Considering the amount of traffic passing by it is also remarkably quiet. Easy check in and out and the staff were helpful with directions etc. It's a quick five minute walk through to Hollywood Blvd. Also a quite safe walk at night.The hotel does have car parking on the second level, unfortunately though this costs approx $22 per night. If this is you're first time in LA it's worth doing the hop on/hop off bus tour. This covers Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and the Downtown area. A good place to eat is the Pig and Whistle but watch out for their half price food nights. It's not as cheap as you may think as the tip is based on the original prices and is added to your bill at about 20%. However good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Useful base for first trip to LA”
Reviews.Author: mrfd1979
Reviews.Content: Very Good, large, clean room, compared to other Holiday Inns. Breakfast, lots of choice of carbohydrates but not much else! Could have done with some fruit. Good location for Hollywood walk of fame, bars, cinemas and restaurants. However wouldn't want to walk home alone at night, the area felt a little unsafe, with homeless people sleeping on the street nearby. The parking was very expensive, but convenient for being in the centre of Hollywood. In comparison to other local hotels this seemed quite high priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Watch the Parking”
Reviews.Author: iron53man
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in March 2010. We had a 2 queen bed room with pullout sofa which was good sized and had a desk, microwave and refrigerator. Breakfasts were free and generous but seating limited. The pool was small and on the 4th floor. Location is great - 2 blocks from Hollywood Blvd, a short walk to the Hollywood Bowl and 5 minute drive to Beverly Hills, 10 minute drive to all 3 networks. About 45+ minutes to Santa Monica and Malibu and parking is terrible. Parking is $22/night whether you use valet or not (that was not stated on HI web sight). If concert at the Hollywood Bowl, traffic in vicinity is a nightmare

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Teenage Daughter”
Reviews.Author: DrMaryJean
Reviews.Content: What a surprisingly fantastic stay we had here. The location is great. Just a block from the Walk of Fame and the outdoor mall, Madame Tussauds Wax Museum, Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum. My 13 yr old step daughter was in heaven. Santa Monica Blvd is close and we drove to Santa Monica Beach. The traffic was always heavy but you can't beat the Santa Monica Pier. Our A/C went out and was promptly fixed by the very friendly and professional maintenance guy. Overall our stay here exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Honeymoon....more or less!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamLisa
Reviews.Content: Despite two disappointing things about our room, our overall stay was flawless. So I am going to get those two things out of the way first so I can get onto the good stuff. We were on our honeymoon and when we booked, we included this information with the online booking. We arrived after a long flight and waiting for a shuttle bus for ages, and it turned out that checking into this hotel was the most stress free and fast thing, which we were very pleased with. We were given room 305, and we rushed to our room and pulled open our curtains to see what kind of fantastic view we had – only to be confronted with a concrete wall and hardly any natural light. When we looked up, we could see the side of the pool. Still, we tried not to be disappointed, not even in the morning when we were trying to catch up on sleep after an 11hour flight, only to be awoken be the constant sound of scraping cheers on the floor above – what we later discovered to be the breakfast room. These sounds started around 6.30am every morning and we were as a result, woken up by these noises every single morning of our stay. Luckily, we had lots of things planned so we tried to roll with it and just get on with things. If you make it to the breakfast room for 6.30-7am you will be able to have a calm, quiet breakfast. If it’s later, say 8.30am, be prepared for a very busy room, sometimes with no seats available. But don’t worry! You can always have a take out breakfast. I’ve read other reviews about the breakfast by the way and how anyone can complain about this FREE complimentary service is completely beyond me. Every morning, there was; coffee, a selection of juices, milk, 4 different cereals, yoghurts, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, toasts, bagels, cinnamon rolls, I could go on and on….there is so much there and lovely staff members who are constantly replenishing and cleaning and smiling. What’s to complain about? Our room itself was very comfortable, fantastic bed, lots of room, cleaned every single day, fresh towels, etc. We also had a fridge which was handy and we were close to the vending machines and elevator so there were pluses to room 305 too! We felt very safe indeed in this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I have to make a comment about the staff. We experienced at least 4 different front desk staff during our 7 night stay and each and every one of them was helpful, polite, and obliging. Whenever we saw any other staff they were as polite and cordial. I wanted to mention this as it’s clear they all work very hard behind the scenes to make your stay a memorable one (and despite the view and being below the breakfast room!) our stay was very memorable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat with a moment of hesitation. Hollywood & Highland shopping centre is a 5 minute walk away, Hollywood Boulevard the same, the Metro station is right there too and is clean, safe and fast. $1.25 one way to go to Universal Studios – it takes 10 minutes tops to get there. There is a Subway more or less across from the hotel and the hotel also has snacks downstairs and meals you can warm up in their microwave and take to your room. Coffee and papers available in the lobby at any time. Worth every penny we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_M
Reviews.Content: L.A. was our last stop on our four week holiday in the U.S. Our group consisted of six young adults. We decided on the Holiday Inn Express HWF based on brand familiarity and also good reviews on T.A. We booked and paid well in advance through expedia.com.au . Having being familiar with the brand I had some idea of what to expect, but this turned out to be by far the roomiest H.I. Express accomodation I have ever stayed in. We booked three seperate rooms for four nights, all three rooms were spacious, lots of space for all belongings and plenty of space to move around. One of the rooms even had a lounge area plus a small dining table. The rooms are not glamorous, plush or luxuruious they are basic but just plain roomy and comfortable. We were all well impressed. Overall it was a good experience. Front desk employees were prompt and polite. Check-in was quick and easy. Comfortable bed and pillows, clean linen and all the other standards you would expect from a good 3 star tourist hotel. The free internet came in very handy on several ocacaions. The laundry facilities were a real bonus. The hot "buffet" breakfast (whilst lmited in choice) was more than sufficient to satisfy our group at the start of each day. Onsite parking cost extra (US$25 per day), this didn't bother us but it is something that you have to keep in mind if you plan to use the parking facilities at the hotel. Valet parking is available, but if you want to save yourself the cost of a tip then try self parking. For airport tarnsfers we went by private van with Go Shuttle. With the strong aussie dollar this place was a bargain! No complaints.. A good experience overall. I would recommend this hotel to those travelling with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: PerthFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: Checked in here late at night, small problem that I had booked wrong date, however hotel honoured booking and did not charge extra. Our room was a great size, had two double/queen beds, a sofa bed, small table and chairs. Also a small kitchen area with a microwave, small fridge. I thought the room would be noisy as it overlooked busy road, it turned out to be a very quiet room. Breakfast was great, it is a continental breakfast, but is more than adequate to get you through the morning. It consisted of cereal, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, juices, yoghurt, coffee, tea and hot chocolate ( I seem to recall scrambled eggs and bacon too, but am not 100% sure). Had pizza and salad from across the road, which was great. There is also a Subway sandwich shop and a small general store. The proximity of this hotel to the walk of fame, train etc was fantastic. It was an easy five minute walk from the hotel to this hub. Many restuarants in the large shopping centre, plus lots of shopping around. We took a bus from this area to venice beach (well two buses), it took close to an hour to get there. Staff were great and helped book a car for our return to the airport, and printed our boarding passes. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: sask59
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet clean hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They also have a good free breakfast. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, breakfast, very clean and great staff”
Reviews.Author: wvu1984
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Hollywood Blvd./Walk of Fame. Hot breakfast was wonderful. Staff was great and kept all areas of hotel very clean. Front desk was helpful. Traveled with spouse and 4 children. Queen suite was large enough for all. A couple carry-out restaurants were right across street (Highland Ave.) One offered free delivery. Front desk provided a menu. We ordered out three times. Great location for Universal Studios and Hollywood sign.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenmalley
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel; in fact, I observed housekeeping cleaning all the windows including the pool windows! One of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. Very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast area is clean, bright, and have employees that are happy and willing to keep food coming! Warm breakfast items and great hot rolls. I had the double queen suite and chose the upper level, 5th floor, to avoid the constant traffic on Highland. Very comfortable beds and lots of pillows! Nice size bathroom and very clean. The suite was great, had a refrig, microwave, little dining table for my daughter and I to eat at. (We were there to cover the Academy Awards). Parking was $22 per night. Traffic is terrible, but Pedro of the Hotel parking staff couldn't do enough for us. Free internet, but get kicked off frequently. No printer in business center and it was a pain and inconvenient that the hotel requires guests to use the hotel lobby printer; you have to wait in line, then the desk clerk heaves the screen and key board on the lobby desk to use and for all to see what you type. Printers are not that expensive now-a-days, hotel should replace the business center printer. I did not feel safe walking the area as a single woman at night; daytime was fine. Nice walk to Kodak Theater. Would recommend eating at The Grille on Hollywood at the Hollywood and Highland center on the 4th floor or the California Pizza Kitchen. All in all, a great experience, clean, great customer service, fab breakfasts, and employees who seem to like their job. Nice pool area, and their fitness center was nice and as well as clean. Check out the murals on the parking garage walls.

Reviews.Title: “Very new and attractive hotel near Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: Hawk34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my wife and two teenage daughters at the end of a week in So California. This hotel appears to be almost new. The decor is fresh and attractive. The building and room were very clean. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was above average for a motel complimentary breakfast. The location is great - just two blocks to Kodak Theater and the middle of Hollywood Blvd sights. We also drove to the Farmer's Market/Grove area in about 15 minutes. Our drive to LAX the next morning over city streets (not freeway) was about 30 minutes. If I wanted to be in this area, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious rooms in a great location for Hollywood tourist spots.”
Reviews.Author: Senator75
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a very large room overlooking Highland Avenue. Room was comfortable and spacious and pretty quiet, despite overlooking the main road. (4th floor) Biggest plus is the location as you are a 10 min walk from the major attractions in Hollywood and also less than 10 mins to a Metro station (Universal Studios in less than 30 mins door to door using the Metro!) Staff were efficient and friendly and got a very reasonable price by paying in advance. Breakfast was a bit of a shock though - plastic cutlery, paper plates and food to match - but not a big issue as long as you're prepared. Plenty of options to eat out nearby. Pool and fitness centre and free wireless were a nice touch. Would stay there again if i got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: brewersfriend
Reviews.Content: Good clean efficient hotel - all I would expect from a Holiday Inn. Manager was very happy to help. They had a very good and reasonably priced taxi - Johnny B which we used for all our trips.

Reviews.Title: “Really Convenient Hotel with some nice extras”
Reviews.Author: Pepper02Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were really happy with it. It is located about 10mins walk from the walk of fame and graumanns chinese theatre and is on most of the tour companie's pick up routes. Our room was nice and big and was very clean. Breakfast was included and it was really nice, the usual toast, cereal, pastries and cooked things. You also get free use of their internet in the business centre, as well as the gym and pool. The reception staff were really helpful in givin us directions etc. There is a minimart, subway and starbucks just across the road which is convenient. Also just off the walk of fame is a shopping mall with shops like Gap, Superdry, etc. There are also a few restaurants there as well. For anyone who likes pizzas I would recommend visiting the California Pizza Kitchen at the mall - pizzas are lush there and are rasonably priced. We got a shared bus to the hotel through Super Shuttle. It cost approx $32 return and pick ups occur every 10-15 mins from airport. Be warned of the way they drive tho, it was a slightly frightening experience after 11 hours on a plane! We didnt have a car there so did all organised tours, one through VIP tours and one through Starline Tours. The VIP tour was a tour of LA including Hollywood, Venice Beach, Downtown LA and Beverly HIlls. This lasted approx 3/4 day and was really worth the money. We then did an escorted trip to Universal with Starline which was well organised and Universal is worth visiting!! We also went to Madame Tussauds on the walk of fame which had some good and bad statues!! Overall though the Holiday Inn Walk of Fame is worth staying at, its clean, convenient and has some nice free extras thrown in!!

Reviews.Title: “Good position for Chinese Theatre, check the pool is open if you want to use it!”
Reviews.Author: crazycollie
Reviews.Content: I had a very long drive from Las Vegas that took 5.5 hours and all I wanted to do was to sit by the pool for an hour...the pool was closed and the clerk said it was a 20 min drive to Santa Monica beach - one hour and fifteen mins later I arrived at the beach - it took another hour and a half to get back to the hotel -DONT TRUST THEIR TIMING!!! Hotel was ok for position for Hollywood Walk of Fame and Chinese Theatre. Clean and fairly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, good hotel, but terrible administration as well.”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: The girl at the front desk was incompetent and very un-helpful. Other than that, no complaints with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad administration.”
Reviews.Author: Hubert_Cumberdale
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for 4 nights. The location itself is quite good, easy to walk into the heart of Hollywood. Check in was quick and painless. The rooms were tastefully decorated and were spacious enough, although there was a strange damp smell on our floor that remained for the duration of our stay. Breakfast was satisfactory, hot and cold food to choose from. We did have a bad experience with our check out. After paying for 4 days parking at beginning of our stay, the front desk staff attempted to extract the full payment from us again, claiming they had no record of our payment. They questioned my wife’s integrity with little subtleties. After we searched through our baggage for 20 minutes (becoming late for our flight), we eventually found the receipt and presented it to the front desk. They offered poor excuses and no apology. If you do stay here, keep your parking receipt.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Natashia
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal for my teenage daughter and I - about a 5 minute walk to the shopping mall and all it's attractions. The room was very clean and beds comfortable. Will definitely recommend this hotel to other families. Although no fault of the hotel we did find walking home in the evening a bit uncomfortable because of the street people.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChannieQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hollywood for the last phase of our American honeymoon and had a pretty good time. Hollywood itself seems to be quite overrated but the hotel was a great place to call home for six days. Check-in was easy and all of the front desk staff we encountered during our stay were pleasant. Had a nice chat with the girls while they were watching the Super Bowl during the quieter moments of the day. They even helped us plan our trip to the San Diego Zoo (and remembered us well enough to ask how it was when we returned). The room was quite spacious though perhaps a little dark with no proper lights, only floor and table lamps. Bathroom was nice and the bed super comfy...not much street noise either and you'd never know that busy Hollywood Blvd was close by. Free buffet breakfast every morning was a Godsend - nice supply of toast, bagels, cinnamon rolls, various cereals, milk, yoghurt, scrambled and hard-boiled eggs, bacon, sausage, juice, coffee, fruit, and more...fabulous! As a tip, it's probably a good idea to swipe a couple of paper plates, bowls and some cutlery from the breakfast room in the morning as although there is a kitchenette in the room, there is nothing to eat your food on or with. Only had two problems during our stay, both of which were handled by staff very, very quickly. Once our room key stopped working and it was immediately replaced by the girls on the desk, and towards the end of the trip our toilet backed up but the maintenance man was quick to fix that also. The free Wi-Fi was horribly slow at times in our 4th floor room...that's probably the only real complaint I would have. The small business centre was more than adequate for those times where we had to email home. We didn't have a car for the whole duration of our holiday but as tourists we made good use of the hop-on hop-off buses that most major touristy cities have. The company we used in Hollywood started from outside the Chinese Theatre so that was very convenient and the information they provided, as well as the variety of loops to take you to Downtown LA, Santa Monica, the hills, etc were great. Ordered in a couple of nights from some of the restaurants listed in the hotel's booklet...good experiences all round. There's a convenience store and Subway across the road (if you can ignore all of the scary people hanging around at night), and the sushi restaurant, Shinto is to die for! Best sushi, and affordable, that I have ever had! Overall we had a great stay at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: garden3129
Reviews.Content: Hi stayed with my husband, kids (9 & 4), mother and mother in-law. The hotel is in a great location for visiting Hollywood walk of fame, Chinese theater, Kodak theater. The rooms were very clean and bed very comfortable. The included breakfast was buffet and quite adequate nothing fancy. Would stay here again if visiting Hollywood although that is unlikely. We are glad we have been but on a whole the place is overrated, dirty and sleazy.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Quicky
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location, the rooms ar large, clean and modern and we found the service was great. What more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: sparknutt
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel on the top of our list based on pictures and prior reviews and then we booked it for our vacation to Hollywood. We got to the hotel and were checked in promptly and opened the door and what a wonderful delight to see a very clean room!! The beds are absolutely the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on!! We stayed for 5 days and we were very impressed on the service and friendly staff. We had to call for a minor issue with our TV and they promptly sent someone up to check it out, and then the last night our fridge went out someone came checked it out and immediately replaced it when it couldn't be fixed. The hotel is at a very convenient location 1.5 blocks from Hollywood Blvd. The only problem with the hotel is no fault of their own, Hollywood/LA County needs to get a handle on the homeless street people it is a very uncomfortable walk to and from Hollywood blvd the first couple of nights but you get used to it they don't bother you, but when you aren't used to it it can be intimidating. The price can't be beat in my opinion and the location is A+ and very close to Graumans and Walk of Fame. I will recommend this hotel to others!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Risk Losing Your Room”
Reviews.Author: lolacita909
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the hotel had already given away our suite we had reserved, in advance, to accommodate 6 people. They would not make any exceptions and crammed us into a standard room with 2 roll away beds that barely left enough room to walk around. They also refused to give us a refund for the difference in room rates from the suite we originally booked and the standard room we were actually given. All they said they would do is "comp" our parking fees for our 2 cars. But watch out, a week later my friend found a charge for the parking fees on her bank statement. Sneaky! They also have the air conditioning preset, because they are cheap, which you are unable to lower manually. Like getting ready to go out in a 78 degree room that eventually went up to 80 degrees? Not. Fun. The managers at this hotel are clearly inept and have no sense of the word "customer service"....good luck with this one!!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: marcusleigh
Reviews.Content: My adult children and I wanted to go on a trip to Hollywood and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on N. Highland in Hollywood. It was very clean and we had ajoining rooms that were modern and perfect for us. The TV was a flat screen and we watched a movie on the premium channel at night. It doesn't look great from teh outside but was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “if you want a reasonable stay in the Hollywood area, there is none better.”
Reviews.Author: queensrow
Reviews.Content: I used to stay next door which has now become a different hotel: watching the current one being built was interesting since it was difficult to imagine how they could have stuck a fully functioning hotel on the side of a mountain, but they have. Complete with pool and two story garage. The rooms are of course newer and somewhat bigger, but the mix now has many more rooms with basic cooking amenities if you cant grapple with going out into Hollywood Boulevard nearby: and nearby it is, 3/400 yds, but luckily you cant see or hear it as the hotel faces the Hollywood Hills ( see my pic of yet another sunrise in Paradise from the top floor of the hotel) As ever the day starts with a wonderful breakfast provided by the hotel and then that room is closed for the rest of the day. As to the hotel itself, generally the staff are attentive and charming and the standard of hygiene is top class. Nobody expects this kind of hotel to be a mind opening experience, but everybody who I come across in the corridors or round the hotel seems to be having a good time: it must be the Hollywood effect. In summary, top marks for the management and the brand and if you want a reasonable stay in the Hollywood area, there is none better.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: hathor10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews. It is in a ideal location for the major attractions and within walking distance to shops and restaurants. The staff were very friendly,the hotel was clean and the express breakfast a bonus with 3 children. Whilst the parking wasn't cheap it was very convenient and worth the money for a couple of days. Value for money it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Bog standard hotel in overrated city”
Reviews.Author: TheLonelyWanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect from a Holiday Inn; corporate, clean, bog standard in terms of facilities and service. We booked a double queen room but were allocated a suite which was good in size. The room is well equipped, although for a suite we had no crockery or cutlery so quite how you could eat what you cooked in the microwave or kept in the fridge is beyond me! The hotel has a small outdoor pool and decent size breakfast room. The warm cinnamon rolls are the saving grace of this hotel. The staff on reception are okay (when they're not cursing the computers!) and the valet staff are superb. If you are looking for a base for a business trip in Hollywood or a brief stop this would be fine. Be warned, if you are staying in the Hollywood area hoping to see lots and experience LA, don't bother. Hollywood Boulevard (where the stars are in the sidewalk) is only one block away, however it takes about 5 minutes to visit and after you've done this there's nothing else to see. If you want to go shopping or see any of LA's seaside resorts, you'll need a car. LA is spread out unlike London - which you can pretty much see on foot or via the excellent tube network. Those in the hotel and tourist information office looked at me like I'd come down in the last shower when I asked if I could walk somewhere or take the bus. Didn't find people in LA all that friendly. Please note I have selected that I wouldn't recomend this hotel, purely for the location and lack of things to do nearby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for exploring Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: AMCCULL
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel in a superb location. Only a 5 minute walk from Hollywood Blyd. Rooms are spacious and clean - and a continental style breakfast is thrown in to. Reception staff were only too pleased to help with directions, where to eat etc. Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick531
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the great reviews for this hotel, I decided that this would be a good stay for me and my boyfreind - and it was!! I didn't realize how close it would be too EVERYTHING we wanted to do and see. Like everyone else has said, you are only a short walk to The Hollywood Walk of Fame, and right there is the Chinese Theatre and Kodack Theatre. As many of the other reviews mentioned, there is a mall right at the corner of Hollywood and Highland that has a bunch of great restaurants to eat at (we tried the Japanese place Koji's which was very good and also ate at U Wink) and a bunch of shopping if you left anything you need at home. The hotel itself is wonerful - the room we had was huge with a fabulous view, the bed was big and comfy, the bathroom spacious and nice, and the overall feeling of the room was very nice to me for what we paid. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the free breaksfast in the morning was awesome. Overall, awesome hotel and an awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AkanaOhana
Reviews.Content: I expected a nice hotel from reading tripadvisor reviews and it was. Good service from front desk and housekeeping. Asked front desk about a restaurant that was nearby and he never heard of it, directed me to "CitySearch" rather than making recommendations. Excellant service by breakfast room attendant, always kept the serving bar full and clean. She should have a tip jar displayed, she works so hard! I handed her tips and she appreciated. Impressed by breakfast assortment and change of meat daily. There was even peeled boiled eggs and delicious warm cinnamon rolls! Our room #508 had a broken A/C, upon reporting, a repairman came immediately. He didn't do much but say it will get cooler, but it didn't. Room could have been cleaned better, found food on telephone and mildew spot on shower curtain. Beds were comfortable and everything worked fine. Dissapointed that 2 cardio machines were broken in gym. Front desk gave me a small discount upon check-out for our A/C experience. Free Internet was great. Self parking same fee as valet. Our rental car scraped the top of the garage ramp everytime between 1st and 2nd floor. Make you turn wide because it is a steep ramp that just flattens sharply. Traffic is very busy fronting hotel so be patient when turning in and out of the hotel. Overall, good value for the price of a newer Hollywood hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: J-L-1977
Reviews.Content: Great location! Just two blocks from the walk of fame. Very comfortable rooms. They have a pillow menu. The free breakfast is not a gourmet experience but keeps you up until lunch time, The cinnamon rolls are delicious. There is a mall with tons of restaurants on the corner of highland and Hollywood Blvd. There is a starbucks across the street. The internet is fast. The staff were attentive all the time. The parking fee is expensive, 22 per day but I heard that is the same in all the Hollywood area. The zone is a nice base camp to explore the LA area, Beverly Hills, Melrose, Santa Monica, Malibu, etc. I would recommend this hotel specially for first timers in LA. All the Hotels in this area are a bit expensive so this one is an excelent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kerkaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with our two teenage daughters. Rooms are large and well appointed, bathroom is huge. The queen beds were very comfortable. Fantastic location to the Walk of Fame/Kodak Theatre area. Easy access to subway system and local buses. Breakfast, which was included in the rate was more than adequate with something to suit everyone. Would recommend to anyone wanting a base to explore Los Angeles from.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: retirednurse53
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed two nights at this Holiday Inn last week. I was very pleased with the rooms. They were clean and fairly good sized. Difficult to find hotels with queen beds so appreciated that. The beds were extremely comfortable with plenty of pillows and our room had a pull out sofa also. My son and his wife stayed in a king room which was also very comfortable. The bathroom is a little small but very workable, nice shower with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. I was prepared for the high cost of parking in LA, so no surprises there. The staff were all superb, went out of their way to help with whatever we needed. The complimentary breakfast was more than most, having many choices to choose from including sausage one day and bacon the next. Yes, they do use disposable products but that didn't bother us. The only downside is their dining area is very small so it got crowded at times trying to get the food or have a place to sit. If you go late, the choices are limited. The pool is on the same floor, although to cold to use it. Also have a business center with two computers to use. We arrived later at night so was a little difficult to find as it was already dark. Not real easy to access from both directions and as we were not used to the traffic missed it the first time and had to double back around. It made for a frustrating start. Make certain that you have good directions. It was a good home base for the two days in LA. Drove to Getty Center one day and my husband and son took the metro to the Lakers game. All in all, exactly what I expected from all the trip reports I had read. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: BuyBuys
Reviews.Content: We were in town for one night for business and I am so glad we stayed here. It's right off the freeway and I love that you can go straight from the parking garage to your room via the elevator therefore bypassing the lobby. We were using a rewards night and we were upgraded to a very nice large suite with two queen beds upon request. The room was wonderful because it's twice the size of the average suite and it had a small dining room table, large sofa and the bed was super comfortable. It also had the microwave and refrigerator which is important to us. Don't hesitate to stay at this property! Oh, request a room away from the busy street, it is kind of noisy when you're trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: stylz98nyc
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very clean, and a great location. The only downfall is parking. $20 to park. The rooms are very spacious. I had the King Size Suite which was a big room. The gym needs a little work though. I like to workout during my hotel stays and it was a bummer that the equipment was broken. The breakfast was ok, a variety of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: hails_79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic value. For the price, the facilities and services were fantastic. The breakfast included is pretty basic buffet but enough to fill you up so long as you dont mind disposable plates and cutlery. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the rest of the in-room services are fantastic. The location is good for anyone who wants easy access to Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood Bowl, etc. Overall great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great stay at Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
Reviews.Content: Used my points this time, Stayed on the fourth floor(outdoor pool/Dining area for Breakfast is on the same floor), within walking distance to the Hollywood/Highland Center where the Kodak Theater is located, and of course the walk of fame, HUGE ROOMS( i have pictures) for public transport, MTA Red line subway is nearby as well as a few buses(156 i believe) has fridge and Microwave as well, Hot Breakfast, bacon & eggs or sausage sometimes, always a winner compared to other hotels' Continental breakfast, only thing was the pool wasnt heated and wasnt indoor, for a holiday inn express i didnt expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Allmyeye
Reviews.Content: I am at a loss to understand the good reviews posted for this Hotel . The carpets in our room were filthy , the lighting abysmal. The breakfast range was poor ,whilst to be required to eat off paper plates. drink from cardboard cups whilst using plastic knives & forks in the dining room was the final straw We checked out after one night of what should have been a four night stay, and moved to another Hotel in the same area paying far less for ten times the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayPerth
Reviews.Content: Myself and sister arrived in LA from Australia on the 25th Sept - unfortunately we arrived at 8.30am in the morning and our room was not available Not to worry we had packed bathers and a change of clothes just in case and we went around the pool for the morning until our room was ready at about midday. I thought the breakfast was great - a bit dissapointed that they use plastic cutlery plates etc - I do enjoy a coffee in a china cup in the morning and eating from china plates would have been nice but it seemed thats what LA is all about. The location was the best - close to the train station and the famous walk of fame - couldnt have got any closer for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: james_rosevear
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights from late November to early December, and I fell in love with this place. The staff are friendly, the rooms are very comfortable and the hotel is modern, it was good value as it cost me US$123 per night. I didn't hire a car during my stay, so fortunately I didn't have to worry about the parking fee at all. The receptionist allowed me to check in at 10:00AM, which was a great relief after a long flight from Australia, and the check in process was quick and easy. I was really impressed with the room, which was clean, spacious, modern and had a flatscreen TV. My room also had a kitchen sink, coffee machine, microwave and a fridge which I found very useful. The hotel is a good base for those who really want to see most of LA. The Hollywood & Highland station is an easy five minute walk away, which proved to be very convenient, allowing me to visit Downtown LA, Koreatown, Beverly Center, Farmer's Market and Griffith Park. Grauman's Chinese Theatre is also within walking distance, which serves as a starting point for Starline Tours.s, a convenience store, a pizza cafe(the slices are delicious and huge!) and a Just across the road there is a small strip of shops with a Starbuck japanese restaurant. The hotel offers free WiFi, a business center with computers & a printer, a gym and a swimming pool which is great for people visiting in summer. The free continental breakfast was very nice. Although the tables were all taken quickly, I stayed on the same floor as the dining room, so I was able to eat it in the comfort my room. I am proud of the concierge Pedro, he did a wonderful job at looking after my luggage on the day I checked out, since I didn't have to be at LAX until that night. I must praise each staff member I met during my stay, they all made me feel welcome and they have earnt another loyal customer. They will see my proud face next time i'm in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location shame about breakfast”
Reviews.Author: julieslf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the Saturday after Thanksgiving with our 2 year old daughter and we were really impressed with the hotel, the room was great 2 queen beds and a good size. Parking is a little pricey but we arrived on Saturday lunchtime and didn't leave until 8pm Sunday night and they only charged us $22. The location is great a short walk down into Hollywood itself. The biggest let down was the breakfast, I went down at 9.10am (breakfast finishes at 9.30am) with my daughter as my husband had gone out. The dining room is tiny compared to the size of the hotel and there were no tables free, I got barged out the way by 2 lots of people who bagged tables that should have been mine as I arrived at the restaurant first, it really is a free for all. I was just going to grab some food and go back to the room when a lovely family offered me their table. By this time there was very little food left and no hot food at all. What we had was good, muffins, coffee, cereal and juice but it was very disappointing. My husband had breakfast earlier at 7am and all was fine, so my tip is to breakfast early, but really on a weekend do you want to get up for breakfast before 8am, they really should have a bigger dining room for a hotel with nearly 100 rooms

Reviews.Title: “If nothing else the location is tops”
Reviews.Author: nodnyls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late Sept 09. Here with my 17 yo son and his friend. Overall had a good experience, one certainly cannot complain about the location. The included breakfast was good for what it is-cereal, scrambled egg, bacon etc. Free wireless internet is always welcoming.Didn't use the pool but it looked inviting. Road outside very busy but we couldn't hear it from our room so no real hassle. About 5 minutes walk to the boulevard, even less if you get the lights. and this includes the red metro line which is handy for getting to Universal studios. The staff were friendly enough without being intrusive. I'm going to recommend this pleasant place as the location and price are well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Trendiest hotel out of 3 great hotels which we'd stayed in whilst in California and Nevada.”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotting1820
Reviews.Content: Room was huge - our 3 adult children shared a room with us so 2 queen beds and double sleeper couch was great and there was room to spare. Microwave, a spacious fridge and coffee facility with a lovely huge plasma screen tv and free wireless internet in room. Bathroom facilty is great and include lovely products. Daily Breakfast surprisingly offered a pleasant variety. Excellent staff, very helpful and pleasant. Hotel set in safe area and situated within walking distance of the Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and many attractions. Pantages Theatre and Universal Studios close by. Will definitely return to this hotel. Beautiful Pool, gym well equipped. Cosy, glowing fire in fireplace in entrance hall and a beautiful Christmas tree really set the atmosphere for the season. Reasonable daily charge for self or valet parking was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “You are in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: hibby237
Reviews.Content: Immaculate rooms, very spacious and beautifully decorated. Staff was unbelievably helpful. Within several walking blocks of the center of Hollywood. Great breakfast. At the prices charged by surrounding hotels, this place was the biggest bargain in town. Richard Hibshman, Lancaster, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location - great staff - 100%”
Reviews.Author: mervous
Reviews.Content: Sitting just 150 yards from Hollywood and Highland this hotel is a 2 minute walk from the very epicentre of it all yet the staff deal with everything with a calm friendly efficiency that it a credit to themselves and the brand. This has to be my new favourite express, it stands head and shoulders over the Crowne Plaza in Redondo Beach. We were there for the Halloween celebrations yet the hotel was still quiet enough for a good nights sleep and just sat in the public areas at midnight watching party people getting ready to hit the town was entertaining enough. Parking is $22 but is secure enough and in any case you can get cheaper if you look close by but we felt it was good value for the security and convenience. Breakfast was excellent for an express and of course was free. The pool was spotless as indeed was most of the hotel, be aware that some rooms have no view due to being below the pool (301 -308 seem to be the worst) these are king bed rooms, so book one with 2 queens instead. I would certainly stay here again, it was a real pleasure, they even looked after our bags after checkout for us for no extra charge - exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE AND OBLIGING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Topbloke68
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the one night in Sept 2009 for a quick visit to Universal. After a long flight from Australia they allowed us to check in early which was excellent. Rooms are very nice, but cramped for a family of five with heaps of luggage. Parking cost you, but breakfast is included and is better than average. Didn't use the pool, but it is small and doubles as the breakfast room as that is very small. Air conditioner is noisey too. But I would recommend this place as it is very close to Walk of fame and short drive to Universal. Note you will come in contact with some undesirables around this area, but this is no reflection on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price, remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd hotel on our 6 day trip. The staff was very friendly and helpful at the check in The rooms are very spacious, modern furniture and elegant decor. It was clean and tidy. The beds very comfortable. But the rooms are brand new so we need to check this out in a year again or so... Breakfast is complimentary but don't expect too much. The breakfast room is a bit tiny for so many rooms, you probably have to wait a bit until you get a free table. However for free breakfast it was okay. The location is top. Simply 2 blocks away from "Walk of Fame". Easy walk. Parking is pretty expensive. $20.00 a night plus tax (almost 20% city tax). However in L.A. parking is most of the time expensive. Overall it was a nice stay, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but didn't exceed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: karissf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was far better than any other Holiday Inn Express I've stayed in. Our room was large, the internet was great and they didn't mind my friend's erratic parking whenever she came to collect us! Our room was ridiculously hot though (even though it was miserable outside!) and the air con was far too loud to have on overnight. The treadmill in the fitness room also wasn't working for the duration of our stay - directions to the nearest park were thoughtful, but the air isn't quite what we're used to. However, due to its location and great price, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be near all of the tourist sites. As both of us are unable to drive, this hotel was the best option for us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: andrewf11
Reviews.Content: Very impressed. For a Holiday Inn Express, this is of excellent quality - rooms were above usual standard, generally very smart, and in a good location for Hollywood. Only downside was breakfast, which was the usual cheap&nasty plastic-y HI Express breakfast (it is free/included, though) Otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean hotel & nice touch with free breakfast & Internet”
Reviews.Author: weallo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights using Priority Club points I had gained from the UK. For 15,000 points it seemed excellent value as many are 25,000. The hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from the metro in order to get to downtown LA which we used. The check-in process was very quick and though Parking was $22 a day though at Santa Monica Holiday Inn it was more. Seeing as I paid for it on poinst I did not mind so much! The room was pretty large and exceptionally clean with a large fridge. The room coffee was rather bland however the complimentary breakfast in the hotel was very good. I've paid over $10 for inferior buffets at other hotels before. The 2 complimentary PC's with internet access was another nice touch. I would definitely stay here again though not much to do in the immediate area other than do the walk of fame.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: karenap
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Located a block from the heart of Hollywood , public transport, eateries and attractions. We arrived 9am hoping only to drop our bags but our rooms were ready. Clean, roomy, kitchenette a plus and free internet and breakfast to boot! Staff were friendly and helpful as well. Being on the street side there was some traffic noise but no more than can be expected in any central location of a major city. Gym and pool were nice too. Would definitely stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: dubone
Reviews.Content: Being well travelled I was a bit dubious about staying in a Holiday Inn even though I read the great reviews this hotel was getting. Well I was proved wrong. A well positioned hotel, with great staff, a great breakfast and good sized and clean rooms. Couple of things to watch out for: - The hotel has rooms that overlook the a busy road. I asked for a change from our original room, which was forthcoming, although I have a sneaky suspicion we were put the further room room away from the front door! - The hotel website states that free wireless internet access is available, but it is not available in all rooms. Our room for instance was obviously too far away for the get wireless access. - No shower gel was provided. Despite asking the front desk times and getting plenty of deliveries of shampoo and conditioner, so I went my own. Overall I would stay in this hotel again for it's location to the Hollywood sights, access to public transport and the service (it's a big chain with a very local feel),

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: OzzigirlPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites for 3 nights when we first arrived in the USA and it was, all in all, a very pleasant experience. The hotel is perfectly situated for the pedestrian tourist ... we were able to walk comfortably to Hollywood Boulevarde where attractions like Madam Tussaudes, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Ripley's Believe It Or Not, and the Disney Soda Fountain await. Across the road from the hotel itself (within less than a block) are conveniences like Subway, a liquor store and a grocery mart, so those without transport are very well catered for. The hotel itself was tastefully appointed, the rooms were clean and modern, the bathroom was spacious and the shower was hot and strong. The beds were comfortable and we didn't hear a thing from the neighbouring suites for the duration of our stay. We stayed on the 5th floor so it was just a short ride down to the breakfast room on the 4th floor each morning for a great variety of breakfast foods on the house. We were able to choose from cereals, toast, scrambled eggs, bacon, patties, bagels, muffins, pastries, hot coffee, yoghurts, juices ... you name it, it was available. We didn't have a problem with breakfast seating either because we always arrived around 7:30am, but things do start do get busy by around 8:30am. The staff were polite and professional without being overly friendly and if I was forced to find a downside to our experience, I would say that the front counter staff could have been more friendly and welcoming. The other downside of course would have to be the price. The room was very overpriced for what it was and parking at $22.00 per day is practically highway robbery, but I guess that's the sacrifice you make for staying in the heart of Holllywood. However, we'd accepted the pricing before arriving and aloofness from the front counter staff did not really affect our stay in any meaningful way. I would certainly recommend the Holiday Inn Express to anybody who was looking to stay in the heart of Hollywood. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here!

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfy room, good parking, well priced.”
Reviews.Author: sail09
Reviews.Content: We are family with 2xteenagers. We stayed in a Queen Queen suite - which was very comfy and sooo convenient. Would have been better with a Queen and 2xsingles - but so few Hotels seem to offer this option?? It's about 100 metres up from the Renaissance Hotel which has a great shopping mall and bunch of Restaurants. There's a small shopping strip directly across the road with a Convenience Store, Subway etc - very handy. Our room faced onto Highland St which was predictably busy traffic wise until the early hours. Heavy blinds helped, and it wasn't really a problem and you shouldn't really expect quiet in Hollywood! Parking was $20 overnight, but very convenient. Enterprise Rental car is a short walk up the road (worked well for us as it was our 1st night in US). Price was surprisingly cheap given it's location. Outside facade looks a bit dodgy - but rooms we gather have recently been redone - and were better than we expected, including large flat screen TV and free internet. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Awesome Location.”
Reviews.Author: jeffandkaren
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. The rooms are large and clean, lots of room to move around. The Breakfast was very yummy. All the staff from check-in to check-out was very nice and friendly. They were helpful in finding a place to eat dinner and things to do in the area. The best part was the great location. Lots of things to do in the area and places to visit. We enjoyed our stay and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “If in Los Angeles worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Will de d
Reviews.Content: Although Los Angeles was a bit disappointing and not worth a visit during a vacation in the West of the United States, the Holiday Inn Express in Hollywood was an excellent choice. Hollywood itself is a tourist trap with overpriced restaurants and shops. The hotel itself has good, clean and spacious rooms. There is a swimming pool and a small business center with two computers that provide free internet access. The breakfast is better than the breakfast offered by most hotels with some hot items like cooked eggs. The parking fee of 22 Dollars per night was to high, certainly because parking for hotels is usually free in the States and there are cheaper parking spaces nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: comeonin
Reviews.Content: Room is clean, quiet, and has a large bed. Aound the hotel there are many convinent places like restaurant, subway, bookstorel, minibar and etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value and great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express easily measures up to some more expensive hotels in terms of amenities. The only thing you skip are the high rates and snooty staff! If you don't think you'll miss those then this is a good hotel for you in Hollywood. It's very central to everything LA has to offer (a 5 minute walk to Hollywood walk of fame, shopping, restaurants, a short car ride to Warner Bros, Universal Studios, etc.) The room was large, nicely appointed, with a flat-screen tv and free wifi. There was a fairly spacious desk and an ipod dock/alarm clock for business travellers. In the lobby there was a convenience centre where you could buy soda, snacks, etc. at reasonable prices. Parking is a bit steep at $22 per night, but we soon realized this was cheap by California standards after being charged $50 per night at the Westin in San Francisco. No need to use the valet parking because there are only 2 levels in the small parking garage and access via the elevator. The included breakfast was suprisingly varied with both hot and cold options (eggs, bacon, biscuits, cereal, toast, juice, etc.) and better than I expected. I've been quite impressed with this and other Holiday Inn Express hotels lately, they're usually a good deal and always seem more like a high-end hotel rather than a regular Holiday Inn. This one was no exception!

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean, friendly, good breakfast, some traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: jmac_van
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights 4th-6th September 2009. Overall thought it was good. very convenient. Although parking is $20 +tax per day it was convenient to park (the ramp is steep so keep the speed down) and they kept a parking spot for us when we got back late one evening which was great. There is limited if no other convenient parking alternatives. Breakfast was good. At night at the weekend the road is busy with concert traffic so there is some noise( I guess depends where your room is) and the aircon is too loud to keep on during the night ( like it cool at night) but to be honest I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but horrible noisy location.”
Reviews.Author: FAMILYUKLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to explore LA and made a mistake staying in this area. The actual hotel was fine - very clean room with great bedding and comfy beds, good bathroom and TV. The breakfast is also pretty good and filling and the kids used the pool in the afternoons. What we were most shocked about was its location. Yes, the Hollywood Walk of Fame is only 5 mins walk, but the surroundings of the hotel are really horrible, on a very busy road. The location is great for the Hollywood Bowl, but this means noise and heavy traffic until very late every night - and this made it hard to sleep. Hollywood itself is very shabby and a bit scary to walk around, which we didn't expect. Not family friendly. If I ever went to LA again, I would definitely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bella123_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend in April 2009 and it was quite worth the money! The location was perfect for wherever we had to go! Staff was very friendly and courteous and always kept us laughing! No issues with services and no complaints on my end. Room was relatively clean, pretty standard. No luxury here but it was a comfortable place to sleep. Breakfast was good. I did find that every morning there was a harsh smell outside our door so maybe it was coming from the kitchen...no idea. Everything is pretty much within walking distance and if you needed a cab, one was handy and could be provided to you by the staff. We did end up renting a car for one day which was so worth it. Alot cheaper than taking cabs throughout the day. Cab rides in L.A. are expensive. Runyon Canyon is close by and a must to see. Universal studios/City Walk is a 10 min drive by cab. Walk of fame seemed like a 5 min walk away and we even walked to Sunset Blvd! Only took us about 30-35 mins. Hotel was not noisy. There is a convenience store across the street if you need bottled water, cigarettes, etc. Last but not least there is an abundance of nightlife and venues are within walking distance no problem. Check out Geisha House, very nice. Lots of cool shops too! Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Just wished we could have had warmer weather as in April it seemed a bit cooler but it is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Won't find a better hotel for your Hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: mushroomkingdom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and had a great time. The hotel looks a bit rough on the outside but don't worry, it's very nice on the inside. The best part about our stay was, by far, the daily complimentary continental breakfast. From memory, it had bananas, 2 kinds of cereal, hot biscuits, cinnamon rolls, gravy, bacon, toast, english muffins, mini blueberry muffins...we never went hungry! In fact, it was enough to tide us over until dinner most days! Don't need to worry about breakfast running out, a friendly lady was there at all times to keep items restocked and I can't get enough of those biscuits! Apart from the great breakfast, the hotel is an easy 5 minute walk from all of your Hollywood tourist attractions like the Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theatre, Disney El Capitan Theatre, etc. There's also a CVS drug store on the Walk of Fame which was great for buying snacks. And the subway station is also right on the corner of Hollywood Blvd and N Highland Ave and is so easy to use if you want to go anywhere else (we went to Universal, only a 5 minute ride). The hotel rooms also have a mini fridge to keep your drinks cool. It's hidden under the TV in a cabinet, we didn't figure that out until our last day! There's also free highspeed internet access which we used in our room on our laptop to plan what we would do for the next day. The staff are very helpful and friendly and minded our VERY heavy luggage for us on our last day while we shopped at Hollywood and Highland mall as we had a late flight back to Australia. If you need any airport transfers, we used a private van from Zippy Shuttle and I can't recommend them highly enough! In short, this hotel is in a very safe and convenient area of Hollywood and I would highly recommend it for other Hollywood first-timers. Should get its own star on the Walk of Fame!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MishaWinchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while we explored Los Angeles, and Hollywood in particular. The breakfast was quite nice, maybe could do with more fresh fruit, but overall - not bad. The gym is nice too, and as it is close to the pool, we could use it while our daughters swam. The big advantage of this hotel is its location, virtually 7 minutes walk to the Walk of Fame. The staff was very nice and helpful too. There is a nice sushi restaurant across the street, which I would greatly recommend, although the building does not look nice, the quality was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jillfern
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this month on the second leg of a two week holiday to California. Booked following good reviews on TripAdvisor. Hotel was easy to find after we had driven from Anaheim. Modern room - wonderfully comfortable beds, flat screen TV, seemed nearly renovated. Great location for Walk of Fame and underground station to Universal. Breakfast very good - breakfast room light and airy. Didn't use the pool as we didn't have time but looked nice. Would definitely recommend and stay again. Not sure why it's called 'Express' as I thought this was the slightly downmarket version of Holiday Inn - which it certainly isn't

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but be careful of unauthorised charges!”
Reviews.Author: kensch
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel from previous good reviews on tripadvisor and for the first few days of our stay, things ran smoothly. The staff were friendly, the room was well set out and large enough, clean and just what we had requested when booking through online travel agent Expedia (which was not the case with other hotels we stayed at). We stayed for five nights and on the third day I happened to find out that the hotel was charging my visa account the daily rate when I had prepaid with Expedia. This was in turn explained to one of the reception staff who promised to reverse the charges. Whilst this was eventually done, it was not until a week later that it was fixed up (had to speak to the manager Corey who sorted it out) and it certainly was a disappointing situation because of the time I had to spend to ensure I got the money back. So, when you are asked to hand over a credit card for the hotel to secure their money, just keep a check on your account and make sure unauthorised withdrawals are not made! On the positive side, the breakfast was quite nice and the staff in the breakfast room were excellent. I was impressed with the hotel being accessible to disabled people, with a hydraulic lift available to lower disabled swimmers into the pool. Two complimentary computers for those without laptops to access the internet and of all the front desk staff, Anthony was always there with a cheery hello and chat when passing through the lobby. The location and price were a big plus for this place, so check it out as a viable option to be near the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: RKOhio
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and great service. Good location for the Walk of Fame and a short drive to many hot spots (Pink's, Formosa, Cut, Nightlife on Sunset, etc.) A bit pricey (And add $22 parking), but not bad for the area. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with out any issues. This HI Express is a little better than most HIE's, within walking distance to Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Bowl. Hotel is located a few blocks south of the 101 which provides quick access to Warner Bros, Studios, Universal, Dodger Stadium, etc. Entire staff was polite, courteous and accomodating. Only problem that I found was that Highland Ave is busy and left turns in and out of the hotel can be an adventure and due to the street lay out, it is not practical to drive around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in a FANTASTIC Location”
Reviews.Author: StripyTiger
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location only minutes walk from all the action on the walk of fame. They let us check in early like 9am that was great after a 13hr flight and the 24 hr SUB WAY accross the road helps when you cant get the body clock right after a long flight and need a feed at 3am. The rooms were clean the beds a little short but very comfortable the pool and breakfast were good for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful view out of the window, but generally a good location for the Walk of Fame, Universal etc”
Reviews.Author: Lisat69
Reviews.Content: We stayed in LA for 4 nights and I chose this hotel as it was closest one to the Hollywood sights. The only thng that spoilt it was the room smelt damp and the view was of a brick wall. I used my Priority points and as a valued customer hoped I would get a better room than the one we got. it was close to the sights though so if all you want is a overnight stay then it will be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood with a Teenager”
Reviews.Author: trumanann
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old niece and I stayed here for three nights. I was an excellent hotel in the perfect location. We walked to the Kodak Theatre, Grauman's Chinese, the wax museum (make sure to go to Madame Toussaud's and NOT to the Hollywood Wax Museum! Madame Toussaud's is MUCH Better!!!) We had an excellent room - we got an executive suite for very little more money than a regular room. Good, plentiful breakfast - nothing fancy. I saw the good reviews before I booked, but this is hands down the best Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in. Amazing location and great price. The hotel is in perfect shape and should be rated much higher than a 2.5 star (Expedia rating).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nairnite09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and from the moment we walked in to the moment we checked out the staff were nothing less than brilliant. From locating restraunts via the internet and booking taxis, to trying to help us sort out problems with other bookings and our hire car the reception staff could not have done more. As someone who has not holidayed the States before and who had come across unhelpful hotel staff in Las Vegas two days earlier the refreshing way the staff dealt with us made our holiday. Room was very comfortable, clean and airy and the facilities were excellent. The hotel is within walking distance of the Hollywood Bowl and Hollywood Boulivard, so the location is ideal. We will return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: too-cold-at-home
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early August and found the hotel staff to be wonderful, they were very friendly and able to assist with any questions we had. Bed and pillows were comfortable, large range of TV channels, Flat screen TV, shower worked well with various showerhead settings (pulse, needle, soft), rooms kept very clean a credit to houskeeping. My husband found the airconditioning to be a little noisy (he is a light sleeper - it did not bother me). Tea and coffee making facilities were fantastic (if you can say that about tea and coffee)! Soaps, shampoo/conditioner was of good quality. Free breakfast and use of business centre for free internet, which we thought was good. Hotel has laundry facilities (washing machine & dryer $2.00 for each, so have your quarters ready - we really appreciated this after being in Veges 6 days prior). Hotel is very easy walking distance to walk of fame (as name suggests) Chinese theatre, Hollywood bowl, Kodak Theatre, you can see the "Hollywood sign" from various locations at the Hollywood Highland shopping centre which is very close by.You can catch the train (Metro) 1 station ($1.25 each way or $5.00 all day) to Universal Studios. Disneyland is about a 45 minute drive away. Our only complaint - We stayed on the 3rd floor and found that it was a little noisy in the mornings due to the breakfast room being above us on the 4th floor, so from around 7 am to 9.30am (breakfast is from 6.30 to 9.30) we could hear the chairs etc being moved/scraped about against the floor. This was only a problem for us because we were not getting up until a little later due to having trouble with getting used to a different time zone, most people would be up and about but with us coming from Australia and staying in Vegas (and being up all night and sleeping during the day) before coming to LA it was difficult for us.
